text: Went to this place at the suggestion of a local, man is this place awesome. Great tasting food cool atmosphere very nice staff. I had the red red wine delicious.
Didn't know what to expect walking away from the Vegas strip.  I was pleasantly surprised! Simply amazing! So tasty!
Absolutely delicious!  Big portions, nice staff & they deliver!  The Buffalo Soldier is to die for!

Overrated. The place is very small maybe 4-5 tables. The service was not that good, not personable. The parking is horrendous.  To top it off the food wasnt that great. The sweet home alabama was not what I expected. Not much flavor in the different pasta dishes. Sad!

Wow what a great place. We just hit this last day of our vacation. Killer killer food. 
We shared a half order of Ray of light and Nights in white satin along with Wind beneath my wings.

Nights in white statin BEST pasta dish I ever had I'm 54 if that tells you anything. Creamy delicious sauce with shrimp and mushrooms   Yummer's 
The Ray of light Fresh and light with GREAT flavor. 
The Wind beneath my wings Where very good. 
 
I wish we would have eaten here our first day of our trip I guarantee we would have eaten here or order take out at least three more days of our trip. Do yourself a favor and find this little GEM you won't regret it. We will be back :0)

really cool spot food and atmosphere wise. all their food is made from scratch, so they can sub anything you want really..just don't be rude about it. but anyway, beer needs to be colder. that's all. :)

Unexpectedly AWESOME dinner find on our first venture to First Friday! Tried a bunch of tapas with funky creative names and shared a spicy noodle soup called Everybody Wang Chung Tonight. Tiny place but worth seeking it out!!

Happily surprised by this little restaurant!  It had something for everyone and the quality was top notch!  If your in Vegas, this is definitely the place to stop!  Only negative I can mention is that their location isn't close enough to Santa Cruz!

out of the way place that was pretty good but not great. first of all, it's tiny. there are 4 tables inside and 2 outside, so don't bring a big group if you plan to eat there. i was outside while on of the kids was having a meltdown, so the wife ordered for me. i got the 'sweet home alabama' which is mac n cheese with popcorn chicken pieces and bbq sauce. it was good but i'm not a big fan of bbq sauce so it was a bit sweet for me. i would have rather had the buffalo soldier (blue cheese mac with spicy chicken wings) but i was sharing with the kid that wasn't a good option. the wife got the hong kong style pan fried noodles with chicken and veggies which was actually pretty authentic which was a pleasant surprise. if i lived in the neighborhood i'd go there quite a bit.
Definitely a hole in the wall restaurant, typical of a remodeled downtown restaurant. However, the place was clean, staff extremely friendly and the food was delicious!! Will definitely return

WOW! That's what I have to say

Came here the other night (maybe it's been a week already? dunno) with my mom. She was worried  that because it was close to closing time they wouldn't be warmly receptive. Boy was she wrong.
The owner's are extremely friendly & nice. 
I consider this place very Bay Area-esque yet in the heart of downtown Las Vegas, YAY  
Really fresh food. 
Fresh fresh salad with absolutely KILLER homemade dressing. Completely exceeded my expectations, I want to go back & try everything on the menu. 

Can't get over how flavorful my pasta dish was, man their food is so delicious!
Lemon bar just unreal. The flavor! don't know how to describe that, you have to taste it, was much more intense in a good way than any other Ive ever tried before.
And quite big, it was twice the size of what I've seen before (that's how I got to try some because I got the chocolate cake myself. Yum, super super moist) 
Small but very clean, very cute place with absolutely GREAT food, professional, caring nice owners, good prices for really good food! 
Cant go wrong
p.s.   .   .   .   .   .   .   my mom has come here several times, she said they are ALWAYS that sweet to her, said everything she has tried is to die for & that she wishes there was one closer to her house lol ;o]

My girl friend and I ate here on a whim when it came up on Yelp on our second day in Vegas. The chef took our order, he was very friendly and the food was DELICIOUS!! We ordered half orders of paradise city and ray of light. It was the perfect amount and It was SO good We are going back again before our trip is over!
Good food and nice clean place ... I ate the "buffalo soldier" there and took a "sweet home alabama" home ... yum

What a great find in a cool neighborhood! We thankfully stumbled upon the Arts District in old Las Vegas...away from casinos and the strip. Wish we had found this area earlier in our trip! Rock'N'oodles is a small, cute restaurant, with a bit of seating for dining inside or outside. All three of us LOVED our dishes and the half portions were plenty. I ordered "Bang a Gong" which was Authentic chicken tikka masala, a creamy tomato sauce with garam masala, greek yogurt and cayenne pepper. Served with sautéed spinach and cilantro over orzo pasta. So delicious! We also ordered "Nights in White Satin": Linguine pasta with white wine, lemon juice, heavy cream and white truffle oil, with sautéed mushrooms, jumbo shrimp, a kick of red pepper and fresh herbs and one of the salad specials with chicken. It was really difficult to choose just one dish from the menu and the staff was super friendly and helpful as well.
Definitely a must do in the Arts District!

No plans of coming here again over the summer since there's no AC in the place. Got our order to go and when we got home part of our order was missing. On top of that, from what we did order (sweet home Alabama full order and buffalo solider half order) there were 4 small pieces of chicken in the full and 2 in the small. For $12 a dish I would expect more then 6 pieces of chicken total. Oh and the garlic bread was a giant hard croton...very disappointing meal
I come here at least twice a month and I can't order a bad thing. If you love noodles and good music this is where it's at. Try it! You won't regret it.

Very original and delicious ideas. Very small, funky location I had the Sweet Home Alabama which I absolutely loved. Looking at the menu, it doesn't look like you could go wrong with any of their dishes that appeal to you. Such a good experience. Thanks!

Rock "N'oodles is officially one of my family's most favorite places to order from right now.  My three year old specifically requests it, and he doesn't even order off of the kids menu.  My favorite that we share is Sweet Home Alabama...yummy!!!  The owner is very kind and always delivers to our door when we order.  The food is delicious, the delivery service is fast and the food is always fresh.  I recommend Rock 'N' Noodles to anyone looking for something different, creative and delicious to eat.

Ah-mazing.  Employees are always friendly and helpful (a lot to look at - decisions are hard because so much sounds so good) and they deliver around the neighborhood.  Great portions (two full orders and two half orders were plenty for four men to share).  I find myself craving Buffalo noodles.
How does this place get better every time I come? We split Buffalo Soldiers & Livin La Vida Loca & we battled for the last bites of each. So good. Come. Just leave me some mac & cheese.
Lunch portion was right amount. I ordered Bang a Gong and it was delicious. Definitely one of my favorite places to eat in DLV!

I stopped in Rock N' oodles for lunch today. For a while I thought the place was pretty cheese ball (just by the looks of it) but it's pretty rad. Small place, seats about 12 inside an a couple more outside, right across the way from The Arts Factory. Independent of the Downtown Project footprint. Parking is pretty scarce but a very nice bike ride from any of the surrounding neighborhoods. Worth checking out! favorite menu items : "White Riot" salad (the clash) and "The Mexican Radio Tacos", carniatas tacos (wall of voodoo)

Also, if they would include, Nick Cave, Leonard Cohen, Ian Curtis/Joy Division menu items I would poop my pants.

This place is AMAZING! We just recently discovered this place and I have not been let down yet. Sweet Home Alabama is one of the best mac & cheese I've had which is especially cool since it's topped with popcorn chicken and barbeque sauce. Living La Vida Loca is a unique but tasty dish especially when chipotle chicken is added. Just tried the Red Red Wine and it's so savory and comforting. Last but not least, those meatballs tho!... The best meatballs I've had. Spicy but not overbearing, tasty but not too busy. DELICIOUS! The variety they offer and the atmosphere is on par. This place is def one of my favorite noodle spots!

Only thing this place could improve on is adding more seating since they can get pretty busy at times.

A great little hole in the wall. If you blink you pass it but dont blink. We had the night in white satin and japanese noodles. Both were delicious with just the right amount of spicy. Highly recommend

Super tiny place!! I didn't see it mentioned in many other reviews, but they have maybe 5 small tables total, so don't try to bring big groups without calling ahead. The food was pretty great though. I ordered everybody wang chung tonight, which I thought was very good. My wife and her sister ordered the ray of light and buffalo soldier. They were both happy with their meals (although I thought the buffalo sauce tasted like funky and vinegar-y). Overall, food was great and worth a visit.

The food was amazing! I had the sweet home Alabama and it was so good I wanted to order another to take home. My husband had the Down By the Bayou and it was also really good. A little spicy for my taste but it was still really good. The place is fun with the decor and the rock songs as the name of the dishes.

Pros
This place has a good vibe , friendly service and located in the trendy art district. 
Cons
Very small has 4 tables guessing 16 seating capacity 
The food is NOT seasoned very bland it had no flavor what so ever and my noodles were slightly cold. The only thing I ate was the side serving of bread  it cost me $40 for two people everything thing is nice but the food.

I have lived in the Arts District now for 2 years it's hard to find nearby great quality food and a welcome that is warm, friendly and makes you want to return however, this place has all all that and more. It's a small restaurant on 3rd and Charleston and offers fresh cooked to order food. Don't be fooled by the name Rockin Noodles as this restaurant has noodles / pasta / salads and more and if your looking for fresh garlic bread look no further. Now you may ask yourself what else could be great here after that,,,,. Well it would be the price which is great value for money,,, great fresh cooked food, friendly clean restaurant and one that won't break the bank for food prepared fresh.  What else is there to not to like :)

when i work in downtown, I always try to eat rockin noodles, simple fresh ingredients. everybody wang chung tonight is the go to meal. i always get it to go because the restaurant is small. there cream puffs are awesome.

We walked from Fremont Street experience to this place on a windy, cool Friday afternoon! The one and only employee we saw was very friendly and helpful. We shared an order of the teen spirit fries, they were really tasty and came with a chipolte aioli sauce which was excellent! We also shared a full order of the Buffalo Soldier pasta dish. It is creamy blue cheese macaroni topped with boneless buffalo chicken garnished with carrots and celery. It was a large portion and very creamy, definitely plenty for two and included garlic toast! Overall we were very pleased with the meal! We felt the value and quality was outstanding! The place is extremely small and we came at a quiet time! 

We recommend this hole in the wall, it's clean and the service was very good!!
Maybe it's just me but it seems as if the downtown is really gaining in popular and so is this place. A fun place to eat, staff are genuinely friendly and food is good and reasonably priced.

This is a tiny hole-in-the-wall place without the hole-in-the-wall atmosphere. The menu had fun 80's and older song name for the dishes i.e. Paradise City, Buffalo Soldier. Incredibly small dining room though, a couple of tables and a couple outside. We sat outside which was nice except we were right next to the bus lane so as long as you don't mind bus patrons staring at you - then you are golden. I would have given this place four stars for the food but the lack of service knocked them down to three. 

Also for a dish made out of macaroni it seemed a bit pricey at the $11 price point after taxes, that being said I tried both the Buffalo Soldier (blue cheese with chicken nuggets with Frank's Red Hot Sauce) and the Sweet Home Alabama (Gouda mac'n'cheese with chicken nuggets with bacon and bbq sauce). 

I liked them both but for blue cheese the Buffalo Soldier had a very mild flavor, I preferred the Sweet Home Alabama (with my own added hot sauce of course). There was not a lot of sauce i.e. cheese but there was enough for flavor and the chicken was perfectly cooked, not greasy, with a crunchy light (panko?) breading. The portion size was decent too and we both left with left-overs. 

Also, tried the Fat Bottom Girls (cream puffs) one with chocolate and one without. It took quite some time to get our food, despite there only being one other customer that was already eating, so the cream puffs became our appetizer. 

My other complaints for service included when we went to get a take out box there was no one at the counter, my friend waited a good 10 minutes or so while trying to strain her neck to see if anyone was in the back before someone helped her. Also, we ended up bussing our own table - I supposed we could have just left everything outside but considering the area we didn't want anything to happen to their serving ware - so considering the lack of staff we decided to help them out. 

My friend ordered a soda and they forgot to give her the cup, she finally asked for it. 
Bottom Line - I enjoyed the comfort food and I think for macaroni and cheese they have some great flavor profiles, however the service was practically non-existant, and the prices weren't cheap, not expensive, but not cheap.
Amazing food and Brian is the best. I recommend "Livin' La Vida Loca" and "Bang a Gong".

It's a tiny spot, I mean only about five tables, but I don't really care about that, what I care about is the tastiness and value of the food. I loved my noodles, they rocked! Such friendly and helpful service, yummy noodles, fun albums on the walls, a great addition to the growing downtown-ish area.
The desserts are amazing! Especially the chocolate bunt cake, lemon bars, and brownie! So yummy!Thank you Bryan!
All I can say noodles for daysss ! Loving the whole pasta thing & can't get enough of the flavors. Will be back better then Olive Garden.

We walked in in a short trip at the weekend. No one seated us, we sat among 2 families waiting for food like us. I could only see the back of a chef working in the kitchen. Impression was bad until the chef came out with foods for the next table. He was so young, friendly and patiently taking time to explain for us about the food. My 6 year-old son is a picky eater who only ate pasta and spaghetti along our 10 day road trip. Food was awesome. We loved every dishes that we ordered and finished very quick. The atmosphere was great too. I like the feeling of communicating with the chef who cooked for us and very passionate about his food too. Will come back when we have a chance.

Decided to try out RockNoodles yesterday and Im glad I did.  Ordered the Buffalo Soldier and my son had the Nights In White Satin.  The half order for $6.95 was plenty for him and was a good deal for the portion....the side of fresh garlic bread was a nice touch.  The Asian wings were good and so were the parmesan fries that came with a nice Siracha based sauce.  One note, the Pitbull/Beyonce/Drake 98.5 soundtrack was a bummer and could have ruined the trip.  Gotta put more effort into the music when you have Rock in your name and album covers on the wall!!!
Had the Devil Went Down to Georgia. It had a good amount of heat, shrimp were huge and cooked well, overall a great lunch. They also deliver, which was great.

We've eaten here on several occasions and have yet to order a bad meal.  Everything is so good. For example, The Nights in White Satin is a clams-and-linguini style dish with mushrooms and jumbo shrimp along with red pepper and herbs.  Come in. You've got to check out the rest.

Fresh friendly small hole in the wall with a BIG PUNCH OF ROCKIN FLAVOR...my favorite is the turning Japanese (their take on pad Thai ) always fresh ...remember fresh food takes time ...so be patience lol .....HUGE SHOUT OUT TO CHEF DAVID AND CHEF GUS!!! ....AND JULIE!!!!

LOVE LOVE LOVE this place!

The Buffalo Soldier pasta dish was my spicy buffalo chicken and creamy blue Cheese dream.  The portion was very generous as well. ($9.95)

The Space Oddity small plate was a delicious balance of tangy and spicy.  I really enjoyed the texture experience with the pickle and crispy beer batter.  Sriracha Ranch sauce?  Shut the front door... so good!' ($3.95)

Fat Bottom Girl cream puffs with choice of dark chocolate or powder sugar were both sinful. ($1.00 each)

Atmosphere was so much fun too!  The soundtrack was epic and the artwork of classic records is great to look at.   The inside seats 12 people and there are heated tables outside with a view of downtown Las Vegas.   
The owner was there and was so friendly and fun to talk to.  I can't wait to go back or get delivery/take-out.  I'm already craving Ray of Light and Califonication!

I usually don't give negative reviews, and I think I'll try it again and see if they change my opinion, but for my first experience, I was not impressed. First off, the parking situation is atrocious; no street parking and only 4 spots at the restaurant. Next up, seating. They only have 4 tables inside and can only accommodate 12 people. If you are lucky enough to get a seat, the constant flow of traffic in and out of the door will ensure that the A/C goes unnoticed.

But enough about that other stuff, how was the food? My honest answer: not good. I was looking for an Asian inspired dish and went with the 'Everybody Wang Chung Tonight'. The noodles were crispy, but everything else was disappointing. The sauce was very sweet and almost tasted like a marsala wine sauce. The 2 small pieces of chicken I did get were unseasoned and tasteless and the broccoli was tough and tasteless as well. When the cashier asked me how I liked my meal, and I gave her my honest answer, she agreed with me! She said that she had the same dish the day before and the sauce is just not right. So I guess it's not just me.
Food is great with owner and chef always there taking duties when I've gone. Great atmosphere, great date place! Highly recommended!
Wow. Great food with a delicious combination of flavors, prices were extremely reasonable considering the high quality dishes. Would highly recommend!!!
Love this place! It's down the street from the bar I work at and always satisfies! Love the crispy wind beneath my wings, Definitely try the salads as well! 5 diamond place in my eyes.

Small place with helpful service. We tried a couple of different dishes, but found both to be a bit bland. They were spiced OK, but the sauce was artificially thickened (we believe), in one case too much sauce, the other dish had too little. They need herbs, and some BAM and Energy to make them attractive and tasty. Looked very 'meh' presentation wise. Slightly over cooked pasta and orzo took it down a notch.

A tad bit hard to find and limited parking but great place! Really nice selection, great food, wonderful friendly service. My entree was way too spicy but really good and upon noticing I didn't finish it, I was offered a replacement. I told them it wasn't necessary and we were heading to a show but they were so nice and insisted on boxing something up for me. I ate it the next day and it was awesome. I will definitely be back!!!
Had there food for the first time today and let me just say it is AMAZING!!! I will definitely recommend this place to everyone!! I had the dish called The Devil Went Down to Georgia!!! :)

I really enjoyed the food here. I tried two noodle dishes. I don't remember the names, but one had short rib in it and the other was a child's dish, mac & cheese with hamburger and bacon. The last one with white sauce was my favorite. I told the guy working there it shouldn't only be for children. It was delicious. The guy working the register was extremely nice and accommodating. He even gave us some garlic bread later, which went well with the noodle dishes. The place is extremely small, but he said they will  be expanding next door. I'll definitely be back for the great food and service!

I didn't want to write a review because I wanted to keep this place all to myself.  

I'm always excited to try a new restaurant in downtown Las Vegas.  This is truly the most exciting discovery in more than seven years.  

Not being a fan of heavy meats or even chicken, nor breads nor fried foods I suppose I'm considered a picky eater.  This is the first place where I choose a dish not by process of elimination but I have to flip a coin throughout the menu to narrow my choices.  The people arewilling to substitute chicken with jumbo shrimp which helps me in my predicament.   There are beaucoup snappy vegetables on each plate for lots of taste and texture.  

I avoid lunch hour because there are less than 10 tables and I'm not a fan of delivery.  Once I get settled in the afternoons I'm always happy with each recipe.  A big plus is that the eating area is captures natural light which helps me enjoy our short winter days.  

Don't expect to find on-street parking on 3rd which is one-way going south.  Try one block west -- its an easy walk.

We have been ordering from this restaurant every Thursday since they opened. We do get it delivered being that we are a downtown business also.  So when we do order we have at least 3-5 dinners that we order.  We have loved the food and talked to others about how good it was.  Today I went to place our weekly order and was told the delivery person was not available.  I did state that was to bad because we had a large order and do order every week.  Before I could even ask the phone person when will the delivery driver arrive since we are working til 7:30 and would still like to place an order.  The phone person said I don't care and hung up.  Now that is terrible service and because of that we as a business will no longer order from there at all.
I am adding to my original review because Abby the chef did just call us to apologize which I thought was very professional and I appreciated the call.  Because the food is so good and she can not always control what her staff does I will give them another try next Thursday.  I hope at that time I can write another review with all fives.
Best place ever! Great staff and amazing food every time!!! Brian is the best. A downtown gem!!!
We had the great balls of fire and nights in white satin. Both dishes were very tasty!!!  The staff was very helpful and friendly!

A friend recommended we have this for dinner over the weekend. She had a great review as they catered one of her functions. This lil gem is just that. It's a small place, w/ amazing food! It only seats about 14 people. Not sure if or when it gets busy, but when we arrived we had the place to ourselves. I had the Sweet Home Alabama (Creamy smoked gouda macaroni and cheese tossed with purple onion and bacon. Topped with buttermilk marinated popcorn chicken and a swirl of barbecue sauce) & my friend had the Great Balls of Fire (Not your average spaghetti and meatballs, our pork and beef meatballs are bursting with flavor and heat from jalapeno and red pepper. Served over spaghetti with zesty vodka sauce). 

My dish was so rich & flavorful. The minute you have your first bite you have an idea of what it's supposed to taste like. Ten you have that first bite & it's even better than you thought. SO GOOD! I got to taste my friend's meal. The spaghetti wasn't anything new to me, but those meatballs are what made the flavor of the dish. It's got a bit of a spice to it. When you take that bite you taste all that meat, then comes the heat. Very well done. 

Rock 'N'oodles has my attention! I can't wait to try more of their dishes.

Park across the street. That's your best bet. 
The get ready for yum!!! 
I tried "Sweet Home Alabama", Hubs has "Crazy Train". 
Bot we're fresh, flavorful and made to order. We both ordered half size. Plenty for both of us plus and nice bonus: garlic bread on the side!

This place made my day.  I have never had such great service.  Best Asian wings I have ever had and the pasta was killer.  I will def come back and tell everyone about this place.  Also the rock/punk vibe is sick.

This place is amazing ! The environment is super welcoming and the decorations are awesome. The music isn't too loud so you can have a conversation while you eat. The food is always fresh and full of flavor ! I love this place and recommend to anyone who loves pasta !
The  menu is fun to read thru. We had the sweet home Alabama and turning Japanese . Both are great. I'm not from Las Vegas but would come back.
The "Ray Of Light" pasta was insanely good!!! The whole menu is so well done. Fresh and amazing. Can't wait to come back!!!

I give 3 stars for the portion. I ate the half portion, enough to keep a weary traveller satisfied. The chicken was pretty solid too. But im sorry i ate there today, because there was a huge fly inside the cheese shaker, of which i used to sprinkle cheese, and maybe fly eggs over my crazy train pasta. I didn't notice until i had finished my meal :( Hope it didn't hatch that many. Restaurant offered me a refund and dessert. Dessert, really? I took the refund. This is probably an isolated unfortunate incident, but seeing how the shaker was bottled tight and the holes were not big enough for a fly of that size to crawl in, i can only assume it had made its home in the shaker for a few days, nesting and feeding till it grew large enough not to escape. This restaurant has to inspect its 'pest status' before a customer gets sick, and before the F&B authorities steps in. No choice but to give 1star overall. First and foremost should always be impeccable food hygiene.

So I've been wanting to try this place for awhile, and creeped the menu several times that I knew I wanted to try the buffalo solider and the sweet Alabama. I was most looking forward to the buffalo, but ended up liking the Alabama a lot more, it was more savory and just better overall sauce and consistency. Buffalo solider wasn't bad but it wasn't even close to what I expected, tasted a bit artificial. That I got drunk and added mayonnaise to make it more creamy and less artificial tasting, and then it was better. The kid order of the "return of the Mac" was insulting, it was suppose to be served with ground beef and diced bacon, hmmm I think I saw ONE piece in the WHOLE thing, it was otherwise just a cheesy mess. Honestly frustrated by that, don't advertise it as one thing to bring a customer something completely different.  Don't be lazy. They forgot my Coke with the delivery as well. The only reason they're getting 3 stars is because of the sweet Alabama pasta and because the customer service over the phone and with the delivery was awesome, good attitude and timely. But I don't know if I'd order again, which is a Shame because I like what there trying to do with unique pasta dishes but just need to be better executed.

Never heard of this place until a friend suggested we meet there for lunch. 
As a vegetarian, I was eyeing the menu trying to figure out my best option. When I asked the counter staff, she very helpfully suggested the "I Think I'm Turning Japanese" dish which normally includes chicken, with a substitution of Tofu. Perfection! Very happy with my lunch with helpful staff and decent pricing.

Dishes with a rock and roll twist, love it! Of course I have my favorites but I like to try different dishes and I've had I liked.  The service is fast and always great.  They've expanded so seating is not a problem anymore.  Good food, good service, reasonable prices, the perfect combo .

What Can I say, This place is Amazing. Did a big order for our company and they delivered amazing service and the food was Amazing as well. I ordered the Sweet Home Alabama, Great Balls of Fire, and for salads China Girl and White Riot My staff loved them all. Thanks to David and Julie.
I go here at least once a week for lunch. Great staff, great food and great prices. I can not say enough about Brien and his awesome staff!  Julie and all the chefs create great dishes.

If you have no taste buds and love TV dinners this is the place for you!!!. I'm reading all of the reviews and wondering to myself Did I eat at the same place? Food was very bland. Went with a group and shared five dishes.  I'm not big on salt but everything lacked salt. I had to pour on the salt to give it even slight flavor. Being a fan of Indian food, I was excited about the chicken Tika masala. It lacked any depth or spice. We tried the pad Thai and the noodles were under cooked. I definitely won't be back or recommend this restaurant to anyone. I'm all for small local business but this place is not a win.

Been here a handful of times and have never been disappointed.  Each time I bring a different friend because i just have to share how great the food and ambiance is.  Its a small - fun - friendly - but most important of all - Delish!  
Also, Julie (whos always friendly at the counter), if you r reading this - keep up the good work.

A great assortment of pasta dishes sure to please any taste.  Did a quick local search while in town and stumbled across this place.  It was a big win! A great place with a quaint throwback rock n roll vibe and just plain amazing food.  Definitely sharing this find with friends.
All ingredients are fresh. The Night in Satin is delicious, the music's jammin', and staff is friendly. 10/10 do recommend. The ample room for seating makes it ideal for dates.

First time in. This place is utterly, absurdly amazing. Prices are reasonable, food is bomb. I ordered the Mama Mia, which is a kind of Greek taco dish. Words cannot do this delicious dish justice. Dave, the main chef there, is a culinary angel. Can confidently say this is one of my favorite places. Do yourself a favor, check this place out, and have a few hard root beers!
So glad we found this new place! Food was amazing and we can't wait to go back. Super fast service ! I want to try everything on the menu. We will be back very soon

Great smaller restaurant that more people who come to Vegas need to try. If you are a noodles fan like me you will not leave disappointed, and on top of that the prices are fair. What more can you ask for!!

I really wanted to like it but the food was just okay. I had the carnitas nachos and sweet home alabama. Everything was a disappointment because I had high expectations based on yelp. Maybe I'll give it another try later if I need to carb load.

I am not necessarily a noodle fan, but have yet to find a dish that I didn't clean the plate. So far everything is going great here including the service! I love the queen location and size. Just had the bang a gong and it is my new fav!  Come say hi to Brian or Susan and have a great meal!
Great unique tastes and lovely staff.  I've been here before and everything on the menu sounds good.  We tried 3 different things and when the soda machine was out of Diet, he gave us a bottle.

This is easily one of the best restaurants in downtown Las Vegas. Every dish is flavorful, fresh and delicious. All of the dishes feature noodles in one form or another (hence the name), and the place is casual and intimate (total seating capacity: 14). Friendly, helpful staff, and very reasonable prices.

What a surprise. Did not expect the food to be this good walking in but my god this might have been the best thing I've had all weekend. 

GET THE SWEET HOME ALABAMA. It is the best thing they have here and you will not be disappointed. You will feel full and feel like you hate yourself, which isn't a bad thing. 

Just if you have a night and can't decide what to eat, come here and let this man bless you with some rockin noodles.

Hidden gem in the Arts District! The staff here are super personable and friendly. They have a cool Guess-That-Song where they write a short bout of lyrics. If you guess the song correctly, you win a free 20 oz. drink with your meal. They offer half and full sizes of their noodle plates for those of all appetites. The prices here are reasonable, two appetizers, two drinks, and an plate was under $30. The food is extremely unique and delicious, each plate being named after a popular rock song. The Sweet Home Alabama macaroni and cheese is something you can't miss out on.

Okay so we came with open minds and high hopes for some great noodles at an affordable price. Yeah...not what we thought. I don't even remember which dish I got but I surely do remember that it tasted like Chef Boyardee kind of bad. The sauce was just bad and the noodles were just okay. I forget what the wife got but she too was not happy with her food. We will definitely not be back nor will we be telling anyone we know to make the visit. Sorry guys.

The inside is nice and cool feeling. The location is good being in the heart of the Art District. The workers are friendly. We just didn't agree with the food.
Awesome corn chowder, wang chung, night in bangkok the owner also threw in a trio of deserts on the house the lemon bar was the  best.

I came here with my sister for a late lunch since we were in the downtown area. I loved it so much that I brought my husband here the very next day for lunch. He approved.

Located on 3rd St off of Charleston, this place could be very easy to miss. The parking behind the restaurant is cramped and limited. Fully expect to get blocked in which happened to me when someone decided to park directly behind me while I was parked in an actual designated parking spot. 

The restaurant itself is very small with maximum occupancy of 14. They have two four person tables and two bar tables that seat two each. The decor is a fusion of very elegant and laid back. The furniture is accented with comfortable pillows while the walls are adorned with various rock n roll album covers.

The menus are located at the counter and that is where you place your order. They also have silverware, additional sauces and other condiments at the counter as well.

Both days I ordered Buffalo Soldier pasta along with Teen Spirit fries.

 Buffalo Soldier fries are exactly what you might infer from the name - creamy blue cheese macaroni topped with boneless buffalo chicken and buffalo sauce. 5/5
Smells Like Teen Spirit fries - Really, really, realllly delicious fries tossed in herbs and parmesan served with chipotle aioli. The portion is huge for the extremely reasonable price of $3.95  5/5
Born on the Bayou - I tried some of my sister's order and was thoroughly impressed by the quality and the quantity that came in a half sized portion. This had the works :chorizo, andouielle sausage, bacon, smoked ham and chicken jambalaya served over orzo pasta. This is a very filling option and I'd strongly suggest on going with the half order option. 5/5
Knights in White Satin - I enjoyed this option as well, it is linguine pasta in white whine sauce, lemon juice, heavy cream and white truffle oil with mushrooms and shrimp.  I found the sauce to be a bit watery, but the overall flavor was solid. I am not sure if they skimped on the shrimp or my husband ate it all before we made our plate switch (I suspect the latter) so I can't really comment on the quantity and quality of the shrimp. The half order of this is slightly more expensive than the rest due to more expensive ingredients I'd imagine. 3.5/5

The staff is super friendly and accommodating. It was also very refreshing seeing them lug in locally purchased food products and ingredients when the owner came by with a car full of stuff. No Sysco trucks in sight for this little gem. 

They also offer beer, solid salad options, and dessert. In addition, they deliver and take out is available (possibly preferred due to limited space).

Both visits, with tip, cost under $30 for two people. Both times I left full and happy.
Not good food. Was served cold, The service was bad too.

Wow!  Hollywood Nights Salad was the best salad I have ever had thus far in my life. 
The mix of flavors from the savory bacon to the sweet of the cranberries were an amazing combination of flavors. That bacon dressing is to die for. The wife had to stop me from licking the bowl clean. 
I will always make it appoint to stop in during my visits to Vegas.

I went during lunchtime with a coworker, and even though it's a counter where you walk up to order, the service was a little rude and surprisingly slow. The girl at the counter basically ignored us after we decided what we wanted, and then she was brusque when she took our orders. It took a long time to get our noodles and order of fried pickles, and since it was lunchtime and we had to get back to work, that's a bit problematic. The fried pickles were good, and the noodles were okay but a little bland. My coworker liked his, but said it wasn't great, just fairly good. I doubt I'll return for more, even though I work within walking distance.

Great service.  Good menu and flavors.  Everyone was happy with their orders. 

Pasta is cheap and easy to make, so I usually don't order it at restaurants.   I was invited here by others.  

I ordered a happy hour glass of wine,  which was $9.19.  Very expensive for a glass of happy hour wine.  

I ordered the buffalo soldier.  It did have a buffalo kick, which was good for me, a spicy gal.  the chicken, also had some spice, but not too much that others wouldn't enjoy it.  So I would say the flavors were developed and defined.  It was a bit shy with the bleu cheese.  It had shaved fresh carrots and celery as garnish and added a texture.  The toast was good, but nothing unique.  Would have been nice to be elevated a bit for a place trying to be trendy.  


I believe the space is being expanded and is a fun vibe with records on the wall and colorful.  It was warm in the room and even a fan circulating the air would have added more comfort.  It seems they are still expanding and will be a nice casual dining place. 

A water station was available for self service.  I liked ordering at the register, I sometimes don't like having a waitress, so you can be at your own pace.

So Brian and crew did it again!  Another successful and delicious dinner for me and guests at my shop.  He hand delivered, gave an entire box of desserts as a gift and rocked our taste buds with fantastic-ness.    The indian spices in mine was awesome, the one night in Bangkok  was refreshing and delightful.  Thank you again Rock"n"oodles!

Seriously so so sooo good! There's a reason people are recommending the Sweet Home Alabama, LISTEN TO THEM! My tastebuds are definitely glad I did. This place has both outdoor and indoor seating but is a tad snug and parking is a bit limited so consider yourself warned. They do have to go options which they package with care. The portions are rather generous and hearty and they come with a piece of garlic bread on the side. I got the 1/2 order and was very full. Trust me, you'll want to pay a visit to the art district for this culinary masterpiece that hits the spot!

This was my first time here. I came across this place while getting my fingerprints done at the police station not so far from here. It's a small cute place. They have records everywhere and old music videos playing. Right when u walk in, there's only like three tables so if u have a big party, I suggest you order to go!! My classmates and I got lucky with our timing so we pushed two tables together. Their pastas are different but it works. My friend got a Gouda Mac and cheese that had barbecue sauce on it! It sounds weird but it worked! It was really good. I got this pasta that resembled chicken piccata and it was also pretty good. Two of my friends had gotten this Hong Kong style noodle that's crunchy but gets soft with the sauce. I stole some bites teehee and it was ok as well. This place is pretty good but just a little too far from me. And the place is also small. Other than these things, I would definitely come back here again!!! I want to try some of the other dishes! Oh and the specials are always written on the wall! They also have BOGO which is like HAPPY hour from 3-6!
This place is awesome! Super great for a quick bite! Fine dining quality pasta dishes at great prices! And the Asian style wings are to die for! Definitely going to come back and tell everyone.

This is my first yelp review even thought i use it all the time.  This place is amazing. Kids loved the bacon Mac.  The devil went down to Georgia was amazing but get a beer to stop the burning on your lips.  My husband highly recommends the Wang Chung tonight.  

Love the small atmosphere.  A great escape from "Vegas" lifestyle.

Wow! We were trying to find a new place to eat and my husband found this place. Amazingly friendly staff, super yummy food cooked to order, and an outstanding vibe.  We will definitely come here again and tell all of our friends to do the same!!

Super good not alot of seating best for a quiet night. Supwr unique all noodle doshes. We got tge special nachos. And veggie pasta dish. The food was super good. The wine was meh! But all around had a great experience and would go back.

This is a very small and simple place.  The decor is of old record albums hanging on the wall.  The seating is limited, allowing seating of up to 10 people max.

The food is very good with creative names like "Crazy Train" and "Everyone Wang Chung Tonight".

This is my second visit...I will defiantly be back!

Recently gave this place a try with my S.O. and immediately regretted it. She ordered the sweet home alabama (mac n cheese topped with chicken and bbq sauce,) I got the californication (creme fraiche tarragon white wine sauce with veggies and penne, topped with fried eggplant strips.) The eggplant tasted like oily mush, and the bbq sauce overpowered the mac. Both dishes were bland and reminded me of ordering from the kids menu at macaroni grill. We also tried an order of their sliders; a pathetic meatball lost in two pieces of french bread. The food is unsophisticated, unimaginative and expensive. The music is awful, and the place is tiny, like 3 tables, tiny. If you're looking for someone to make fresh versions of microwavable dinners, look no further.

This place is absolutely amazing! The music, the atmosphere, the service, everything was 5 star. It was happy hour, so we got buy one get one for free. We ordered Ray of light and nights in white satin, both were incredibly delicious. The pasta was cooked just right. Plus, they can make pretty much everything vegetarian. We will be back!

One of my favorite places downtown! Sweet Home Alabama is my definite favorite, the breaded chicken and bbq sauce just brings everything together so well. Also adore Wind Beneath My Wings, some of the best chicken wings I've had, so very tasty!! I've tried most of their dishes, and only one or two weren't for me, but that's just my personal taste.
 Extremely friendly staff, and huge portions, expect leftovers! And the bread that comes with each meal is wonderful. Tiny little restaurant, but well worth it!

Rock'N'Noodles is a very peculiar place. Its an off beat pasta spot that specializes in eccentric pasta, rather than tradition pasta places that specialize in one. The vibe is very modern and the hospitality is great. I had the Nights in White Satin and the Buffalo Soldier, along with their Parmesan fries with aioli dipping sauce (dubbed Smells Like Teen Spirit). The food was really good, unfortunately I was too eager to take a picture to post  would recommend!

Really cool spot. The cashier was freindly and polite. The food was good. We got a few different dishes and everthing was fresh enough and delicous. I only gave 4 stars because ofnthe seating situation. If you are considering trying the food here you will be satisfied.

A restaurant specializing in pasta dishes named after classic rock songs? Sign me up!

Went in and placed an order to go, wait was fairly reasonable considering I was right behind another couple that had walked in. Staff was polite, restaurant was clean, treats in dessert case looked appetizing.

Ordered the Sweet Home Alabama and the Slide meatball sliders- sliders were solidly average, but I appreciated how they were packed with an additional cup of marinara for dipping. Pasta dish was a good-sized portion with delicious gouda sauce, 7 pieces of barbeque popcorn chicken (a little dry inside), and some red onions. Initially I was a bit apprehensive about this dish, but it really worked. Even the slight dryness of the poultry was easily overlooked by the sauciness of the pasta.
Very pleased with my order.

Final note: take out orders are packed in the brown cardboard boxes, which is a lot nicer and more environmentally friendly than styrofoam. Portions for the pasta are large, saved half my order and the extra slider for tomorrow's lunch. With tip, total was under $20.
Got takeout. 2 salads & meatball sliders. Everything delicious. We will definitely be back to try the rest of the menu!
The variety is great , love to see a good food downtown. Staff and food are wonderful .Try the Ray of light:):)

Out of the way and off the beaten path. A Las Vegas gem!  The food was delicious and the service very good. They were short-staffed and we arrived in their last hour but they did a great job, with a smile all the way! Definitely will be back.
Very cool place with album covers as decor and great rock music!  Awesome menu with unique pasta dishes and they have beer and wine.

The wait is finally over after what seemed an eternity to me! 

I always get excited when a new restaurant opens downtown because that means more places for me to choose from when out on lunch.

I decided to go with the buffalo soldier, it sure had a nice kick, let's just say I was a boogery mess after my meal. I was pleased! 

The food was definitely scrumpdidiliumptious.  The sauce was to die for, really rich and creamy and packed with a lot of good flavor. The noodles were cooked to perfection and the buffalo chicken was cooked just right with no fat at all, thank god for that because it seems that I always get bad luck with that wherever I go, ha! 

I think I've found my new favorite restaurant. I have to try everything on their menu. They're just too good not to!

Yummy fresh food! Lots of good options to choose from.  We got the devil went down to Georgia and the bang a gong. Followed by delicious cheese cake.  The half size was perfect for lunch.  I love that substitutions of meats/shrimp/tofu are all welcome in dishes.

This little place looks like it is going to be expanding soon, which is great since people seem to love it.  I wouldn't walk here when it's dark if you happen to have that option as the neighborhood isn't the safest.  It's a cool place, but my family was far from impressed by the food.  My husband is not great with words, but he described his Hollywood Nights salad as "pungent." His spinach was drenched in sauce and way too flavored for our taste.  Same with my One Night in Bangkok.  It was actually warm and not cold noodles and again drenched in way too much sauce.  We managed to eat everything but the cook was heavy handed with the flavors.  My son had the Return of the Mac which I did not try, but it smelled great and he ate most of it.  I enjoyed his subtley flavored garlic bread.
Great food.  Not a ton of space.  Great locally owned spot.  Buffalo Soldier was legit.
Cute little spot for dine in or carry out. They craft an amazing fusion of ingredients that comes off very unique and tasty. Highly recommend.

I've been coming here for well over a year now and it's my addiction spot. The portions are large and the food tastes amazing. They do have 1/2 orders on some of their dishes, so you may want to check that out when ordering a heavy pasta dish. I'm not big on spicy so I've stuck to the Sweet Home Alabama with fried chicken and a rich gouda sauce with barbecue (i'm pretty sure i gained 5lbs from this dish). 

If you want an amazing cold dish, I have two recommendations: Hollywood Nights, a spinach salad with bacon AND warm bacon dressing, and Walking on Sunshine, a highly addictive orzo pasta salad which is my new fav!!

Bonus: they have an amazingly friendly staff. Con: there's been a couple times were my dishes have come out different from the time before and I do like consistency, but nothing too dramatic to make me take away a star.

AMAZING!!! Hands down one of my new favorite spots! I had the small plate of "big balls" OMG, so good as well as was the "space oddity" dill spears fried. I don't usually like spears, I prefer chips but I took a chance on them. Yum! I have no complaints at all. My sister and her boyfriend ordered the "slide" spicy meatball sliders, sweet home Alabama (which they both loved and seems very popular), and "nights in white satin". They got the half size of both which of is a decent size, the full size has got to be huge lol. Overall we loved the atmosphere and design of the place. Really cool and fun. Can't wait to return and bring more people to enjoy this place!

Wow now that's how you treat an out of towner great food just wonderful. Fast service polite people. A vacation from my vacation 

Thanks so much. Thom

I've eaten in twice, today first time for take out. First rule, eat in... you easily get two or three times the amount of food for the same price. Next, check your order. I'm vegan and I always modify. My take out had meat in it. When I called back to ask nicely to remake my order, the guy argued with me and said "the cook said he didn't put meat in it."  Trust me, I would be eating it if it didn't have meat in it. The food seems fresh, and like I said, if you eat in there's plenty for leftovers. Team Noodle, my real suggestion is to add a vegan pasta to the menu so there's no confusion or arguing with the "cook" about what should be on the dish. Keep it simple and everyone will be happy.

Amazing fusion food! Hilarious menu names.. A true gem in the arts district/ downtown. They deliver to a local bar and they are super quick!

Fusion food at its finest!

Since leaving Seattle and Il Corvo, I have deeply missed delicious amazingly fresh pasta by the dish. Rock'N'oodles had me at Sweet Home Alabama. 

My friend and I were here with a Meet Up group and we all shared dishes, which is good cause I pretty much wanted to order everything on the menu, no seriously, everything. Half orders are still large, but who doesn't love leftovers?

Ray of Light
Penne pasta tossed with pancetta, pine nuts, asparagus, white wine and lemon juice, finished with a heaping handful of fresh spinach and parmesan cheese.  
- I wanted to love this but for some reason I didn't, the execution was great, pasta al dente, but it didn't do it for me.

Sweet Home Alabama
Creamy smoked gouda macaroni and cheese tossed with purple onion and bacon. Topped with buttermilk marinated popcorn chicken and a swirl of barbecue sauce.
- Dear lord, this is heaven and hell, heaven for my palette and hell for my waist line. So good, go get it! The chicken was breaded wonderfully and the chicken was still moist. 

Nights in White Satin
Linguine pasta with white wine, lemon juice, heavy cream and white truffle oil, with sautéed mushrooms, jumbo shrimp, a kick of red pepper and fresh herbs. 
- I wanted to order one to go after I tried a bite, spicy and delicious, plus anything with truffle, I'm sold. 

Buffalo Soldier
Creamy blue cheese macaroni topped with boneless buffalo chicken pieces with julienned carrots and celery. 
- I don't like blue cheese, like seriously am against it. However even though I could taste it, it wasn't over powering. If you love blue cheese, get this one, my friend does and she was in love.

Everybody Wang Chung Tonight
Hong Kong style pan fried noodles in a rich broth seasoned with shaoxing wine and oyster sauce with thin sliced chicken breast, carrot, broccoli, shitake mushrooms and julienned scallions.
- So good! The noodles are super crispy and the flavor was amazing. Try it, you'll like it.

Bang a Gong
Authentic chicken tikka masala, a creamy tomato sauce with garam masala, greek yogurt and cayenne pepper. Served with sautéed spinach and cilantro over orzo pasta.
- I love chicken tikka masala, however this version I wasn't into, I'd rather have the real dish.

Overall love it, yes parking sucks, yes its super tiny, but the staff is friendly, the music great and the food is amazing - if you've been thinking about going - go do it!

I like the half sizes for lunch just enough to fill you up but not overly full.  I had the Night in White Satin which was good not too truffly.  I was worried as I don't like too much truffle oil.  Flavor was yummy!  It's a pretty small place, only 4 tables and it did take a while to get our food.  More of a take out place.

First let me say, I was in a foul mood when I said to myself, "screw it just try this place though way too many hipsters have said they like it." Thank you inner I hate the Ogden voice. 

This place is so good I'm Probably going to have a restraining order placed on me because I'm going to always be here. 

I wish I'd made notes of what I had with names but F it. I had some Indian type of noodle dish that I wanted to go sit in a corner all "Girl Interrupted" and just curl up in my chonies with a fork and this stuff. 

Right now over 24hrs later I'm eating COLD leftover noodles with fried chicken pieces on top. Slap my left nipple cause it's twitching from a tastegasm! This is seriously freaking good. I'm talking spotting a republican congressman in a park bathroom wide stancing good. 

And oh my gawd Chandler Bing! The fried pickles. Yes. Breaded fried pickles. Hi, I'm going blind cuz I'm touching myself ever since I put the fork in my mouth. The #foodporn is killing me up on this beeyotch! 

Note: the rock n roll theme is totally authentic. The owner seriously knows his rock, especially the cheesy stuff. I'm loving this joint go support it so I've got a place to get my #snackgasm on!

The food and service are awesome (this is why I didn't leave 1 star)
The only reason I gave this place 2 stars is because of their Gluten Free items.
I'm not sure if the GF noodles are cooked in the same water or handled improperly or even the sauces not being gluten free. This place made me horribly sick. (Within 30 minutes of eating)
Celiacs & Gluten Sensitive people don't go until they properly handle Gluten Free.

The food here is awesome! Each entree has it's own taste and I love how the chef can modify the entree per my allergy. The staff including owner are so friendly and accommodating and are able to recommend things on their menu by what you enjoy. I love how they have specials everytime I come in. Their fried pickles are so good, definitely worth trying if they have it. I have not been disappointed by any dish so far and portions are large, come hungry! Don't forget to try the desserts! My boyfriend and I will surely come back and try every pasta dish. LOL.

The only downside is that it's a small location with limited parking BUT you can always grab it to go!

A-  Sweet Home Alabama: The popcorn chicken is crunchy and tender in the inside. Very flavorful! This one is for the barbecue sauce lovers

A- Born on the Bayou: Hearty taste from the sausage and bacon. 

A+ Nights in White Satin: One of my faves! Cream sauce is light and not overpowering. Great flavor from truffle oil. I substituted the shrimp for chicken. 

A+ lemon bars: OralGASM! Enough said. Moist, melts in your mouth.

If my clueless 90 year old Yiddish grandma was assigned to open a rock n roll themed "noodle" restaurant, I think it would be exactly like Rock'N'oodles. What is rock n roll? Here anything goes. Same with all their dishes. Anything that has a remote resemblance of the wheat meets water phenomena known as a noodle or pasta will be served here, no matter if the chef can cook it well or not. Never fucking again!

2 star food, 4 star decor. 

One night in Bangkok- a little too sweet, but not terrible. Store-bought noodles. Pre-shredded carrots, etc. We ended up sharing this because my wife didn't eat her own dish. 

The Devil went down To Georgia - frozen shrimp, store-bought noodles, bland sauce. Meat and shrimp seem to not be cooked in the sauce. Overall flavorless. Left it uneaten after about 5-7 bites. Tried doctoring it with salt, pepper and hot sauce, but the patient was too far gone. 

Fun decorations and good music. Maybe a good happy hour spot, but not cutting it as a restaurant. 

Parking is difficult.  Will not be back.

What a pleasant lunch experience, really good food, excellent and creative menu options, feel-good decor. Thanks Yelp for the reviews. I had the Sweet Home Alabama, half portion, and the portion was generous. Sweet, tasty and just the right amount of richness. My husband had the special called Scarborough Fair with chicken, asparagus, capers and linguine in a sage butter sauce. Both were cooked to order.  We ended with a freshly baked lemon bar, yumm. I did not give 5 bars due to parking limitations.

Good old Yelp to the rescue again! On a recent trip to Vegas, we wanted to avoid the strip and busy tourist areas and found Rock'N'oodles. I had expected it to be a ramen joint from the name, but they had so many delicious pasta choices! I ended choosing "Paradise City"- a chicken Alfredo & got a half portion which was only $8 and was more than enough for me. My friends got a taco dish and an Asian noodle dish and we all devoured everything. The staff was courteous and attentive & I'd definitely go back!
Great food! I had the livin la vida love and also tried my two friends' dishes, everything was amazing.

I've been back multiple times since the first "disappointing portion size" time, and since that issue appears to have been resolved, I have nothing but great things to say! I've since tried 4-5 other dishes and would order all of them again!! Love the bread!

Amazing!! We went in the pm and it was pretty dead as is most of downtown, but that means there's no wait so good for us! I got their version of pad Thai, my friend got an Italian variety can't remember the name but had pesto. Everything was sooo goood. The only downside is their beverage selection

Oops - i never finished this review! We showed up right before closing the night before Thanksgiving. I had called and asked how late they were open, he told me and then started to close early. 

When we got there they were closing early, and he asked if I was the one that called. He apologized and proceeded to comp us on our dinners for takeout (we had been planning on eating there.) We talked about his experience as a restaurateur and the Fremont Experience area of Vegas. 

The food was great - stop in and say hi!

I was shocked, this place is great! The bathroom is spotless and the kitchen looks clean. You gotta hustle on down here this place is good. I had a bangkok noodles with the cilantro a chicken and it was really good and a hearty portion.

This place is amazing! Caters to multiple needs and leaves you satisfied! Great ambiance, prices are awesome and affordable and honestly an all around experience. Great little hole in the wall, music inspired dishes that are insanely good.

This new Art District gem is officially a fabulous new addiction of mine. Could I give 4.75 stars, I would. The food is a 5. I've tried three dishes now, and even cold the day after, my tummy is smiling. The ingredients are fresh and original, the noodles are fabulous (and I love me some noodles), and the vibe/decor are awesome if you, like me, like to feel the urban vibe of a rockabilly. Pomp's obviously welcome. The only problem: (Aside from the place being around the corner and dangerously easy to visit non-stop): the outdoor seating, while convenient and cute for the little space they have to work with, is not that great if it's more than you and a plate. But inside is fab and the staff was great, so I recommend a visit for yourself, especially the next time you stumble out of the artifice or velveteen rabbit and need some noodles.
I had the best noodled last night,food was more than great .excelllent customer service.very decent pricing for a good meal aswell
The sweet home Alabama was very good and Korean tacos were phenomenal!! The seating area was very small and the street work made it hard to find but it was worth it!

I have been to this place a couple of times.  The food is awesome.  Had the Sweet Home Alabama last time and it was great.  Great place for a quick meal. The staff is very friendly and the food is outstanding.
Awesome food, great service, and music! We tried the Greek salad, the devil went down to Georgia, and the Buffalo soldier. All of it was wonderful!:)

I stopped in for lunch today as I was craving Mac n Cheese. So i ordered the "Spicy Meatballs" and a 1/2 order of the "Sweet Home Alabama" Spoke with the chef about the dishes briefly and he was very polite. The flavor of the food was exceptional, homemade meatballs, freshly fried honey BBQ chicken to top my Mac n cheese with some tasty smoked Gouda & bacon. I ordered a fountain soda as well because they had cherry syrup to make homemade cherry cones, beer and wine are available as well.

Wow this place blew me away. If you like noodles or pasta you will not be disappointed. Its' location is less than optimal,  just off Charleston and west of Main but well worth the effort. I had carry out and the flavor blew me away. It looks like they will be expanding to add more seating which should make the experience even better.

Love love loved the Sweet Home Alabama! Mac&Cheese with a twist and I've never had better, the popcorn chicken on top was an amazing addition to it too. The next time I'm in town I will definitely be back!

This place is amazing. Don't let the size of this restaurant fool you. The servings are very fair!

I usually order takeout because people always stare at what I order! Sort of like a group of seagulls on spring break watching Jonah Hill eat a meatball sandwich on the beach. It comes with the territory I suppose. There is something here for everyone! No one gets left out. Not even the vegans, I hope.

I order the Buffalo Soldier. I love buffalo sauce and the bleu cheese turned me off at first, but like I said "This place is amazing."
Life changing meals that are cheaper than a psychiatrist! 

The only CON about this place is the amount of bread you receive with your pasta. Call me a snob or picky. I truly don't care. When it comes to pasta, bread is an essential partner in crime for this dining experience. I receive roughly over a pound of pasta whenever I order the Buffalo Soldier. The only thing I can compare this horrible strategy of service is the way chicken wing restaurants distribute their ranch. It's a stingy move and very annoying. There is going to be that moment where customers are going to be hungry and THEY WILL compare the destinations of interest. The little scrap of bread you provide with your pasta will not go unnoticed. Fix it, please. 

That is all.

I have walked past this location several times during every First Friday. Today I finally decided I wanted to eat something different. The menu is small and simple. There is also a lot of different varieties of food choices, all of which are made with a type of noodle. This establishment has gone above and beyond with what they can do with a noodle. The interior is decorated with records along the side of the wall. The staff members are all passionate about the food they create and how they serve it. I ended up trying the "One Night in Bangkok" noodle dish. The flavor was outstanding. The explosion of flavors and the sweet chili they use just completed the dish. Definitely a must try spot

When balls of fried chicken have sexual encounter with Mac and Cheese.... They make a beautiful baby. 

And I am going to eat that baby.
YUM!!!!!!  Really all the entrees  have good flavor and desserts you cant walk out without at least one!

Rock you like a Noodlecain! Down in the Arts District in old Las Vegas you'll find a noodle joint so rockin you'll 


Wow these some of the freshest pasta dishes I've had in Las Vegas. My ingredients in my dishes tasted so fresh it's like moms in the kitchen. We ordered a few dishes but I only remember my Great Balls of Fire pasta dish & my Hollywood Nights Salad. Meats balls are really tasty but have a explosive kick to them. The give you a real Rocky Balboa punch so beware. As for the salad OMG, I'll just say anything with bacon added to it just rocks. It's a refreshing spinich salad with bacon & feta but it was the dried cranberries with bacon dressing that drove me insane. I started head banging right I the spot ( just kidding ) cause it was so tasty.

I'd highly recommend coming in. Where else can you rock & noodle yourself out!

My noodle got rocked.  Pretty quiet on a Saturday afternoon, sat down and ordered up. Wife got the "bamer" and I got the "light".  Both were fresh and tasty. Lost the game of lyrics for the free soda but was given a cream puff for desert. Thanks! Awesome place, enough said, go.

Have you ever had deep fried pickles?  It is call Space Oddity here and is only $3.95 for 5 dill pickles spears coated in beer batter and deep fried to perfection.  It is served with sriracha ranch if you wish.  They also have other small plates like crispy chicken wings in asian glaze and spicy meatball sliders.  Of course they also have entrees.  Check out the menu at www.rocknoodles.com  Give it a try, you won't be sorry!  They have cozy seating inside or seating outside.  Delivery is also available.

3.5, solid 3.5. 
Want to know why I went with 4 and not 3? THE PORTIONS!! Holy mother of Italy who needs that much pasta!?! By no means is that a complaint either! I love when I can enjoy leftovers of a great meal! Especially carbs. 
A place easy to miss if you're not paying attention. Also, a place that can pay its rent in one First Friday if they play their cards right. I am all about adding family friendly establishments to downtown. This one fits that description perfectly. A small, "hole in the wall" with the walls plastered in album covers and the dishes named after songs. IE: Great Ballls of Fire, Born on the Bayou, Smells Like Teen Spirit, and Return of the Mac. Such a corky concept that fits in the unique, younger, artistic culture downtown has grown accustom to these last couple of years. 
To me the food was average other than the Smoke on the Water salad. This is a salad you would think has meat because of the smoky flavor but it indeed is vegetarian. Its a huge portion of baby greens, tortilla strips, tomatoes, corn, avocado, and a smoked chipotle vinegar dressing. I did NOT need to order a pasta as well, but the blue cheese in the Buffalo Solider did not disappoint! I could tell the food was fresh, but I am not sure there is anything that blew my mind where I will be left in craving mode. Don't get me wrong, I will totally eat here. Again, and again. Hopefully next time I will be "wowed" 
I leave with expectations of writing a 5 star review in the future.
I love going to this restaurant and the best food there is their pastas and I also love their fries. I go there with my wife all the time and also my friends and I hang out there a lot

I saw this place just on a whim search of Yelp. I'm so glad I found it. My party loved everything we got. We will definitely be back! The fried pickles were my favorite, but the meatballs were also so good! The employees were all really awesome and answered any questions we had. If recommend this place to anyone looking for a great, fresh meal and some interesting choices.

We came in here one night after venturing around. We had a girls day and decided to end it with some wine and noodles... What better spot than rockNnoodles?

We came around 730. There were a few people sitting in the booth... So we opted for the tall table. Lots of people were coming in to pick up their food, so I'm assuming it's a popular to-go spot. Please note: the space is really tiny. It's not a spot for large groups, but perfect for a few friends or couples. The decor is pretty neat... They are definitely rock and roll themed. An entire wall is dedicated to nothing but plaques of different eras of rock and roll. It's actually a really great idea.

The menu... Well... Everything including the menu is rock and roll themed. We ordered the ray of light: Penne pasta tossed with pancetta, pine nuts, asparagus, white wine and lemon juice, finished with a heaping handful of fresh spinach and parmesan cheese.  Full $10.75 - Half $6.75.  We opted out of the cheese and pancetta to make it vegan. We shared a full size, as it was definitely enough for two. It was delicious... I'm not really a pasta person... But even I enjoyed it! I can't wait to come back and try some of their cold pastas. 

The gentleman at the counter was super nice and patient with us. We had a a lot of questions and were pretty indecisive. He was definitely helpful and super friendly. Oh.. I forgot to mention, you order at the counter and pay. They bring the food to
You. Everything came out quick and tasted fresh. This is definitely my go to for carbohydrate indulgence!

I work downtown and cannot get enough of this place. It's tiny, but sooo good! I'm on a mission to try everything on their menu. I'm about halfway. The cooks have each created their own pasta dishes to add to the menu. Sometimes I just ask for the current cook's creation. I have never been disappointed. Too many good dishes to list. Seriously, love them all. But the Buffalo Soldier and Nights in White Satin are "can't miss" for any new comer.

I've been here about 5 times now and every time I go in I'm always greeted with a warm welcome by the cashier. The place is always clean. The cook/ chief even came out to ask me how everything was. My favorite dish is "the devil went down to Georgia" and they have the most delicious fluffy chocolate cake that you must try! I'm so glad I found this place and will continue to be a loyal customer!

I like to rock out with my noodles out, so naturally I like this joint. I would tell you about the dishes I order, but I just checked the menu and they have been removed, so I won't waste my time :) I will tell you that the prices are right, there's free delivery and the eats have never disappointed. So there's that. The parking sitch is a bit tight, so be prepared to park across the street. The joint is small, but there is some outside seating. Def great for a quick, fresh meal downtown!

Great pasta.  I had their Ray of Light and will definitely try the Buffalo Soldier next time.  The only thing I regret is that I didn't know I could order their food and have it delivered to Hop Nuts.
I always love the food. Really glad for the expanded dining room. Flavorful dishes! Go with the Buffalo Soldier for comfort food. Go with the Ray of Light for something light and full of taste.

Questionable looking block, but food was good! We got half orders and it was plenty for lunch. Loved the prices $7-8.00. Happy with all we ordered: Sweet Home Alabama, Paradise City, and Ray of Light.

I went here last night and if it were my choice, Id go here again tonight. If you want some tasty noodles, go here. I had quite a hard time choosing actually. I ended up getting the buffalo soldier a mac and cheese with blue cheese and buffalo chicken strips on top and it was the bomb! I was a little afraid of too much blue cheese but it was just enough in sprinkles on top of the mac. They only gave me two small chicken bites which at first I thought... come on but after I cut them up it ended up being the perfect amount to pair with this dish so the buffalo did overpower it.  Super creamy and tasty. I also love that you can get half portions because I hate to waste food and in vegas I dont wanna carry around mac and cheese all night. I almost didnt finish my half portion but it was too good. My mom got the great balls of fire which is a spicy spaghetti. The meatballs were really tasty and this was great for a spaghetti but depending on your preference it needed way more spice.  This place is tiny! Maybe 4-5 tables for only 2-3 people each inside and a few tables outside. They do have a good wine selection now.. i read a review earlier that said there was no alcohol.  After our meal, Brian (who might be the owner) heard us calling for a cab and having trouble and he offered to drive us down to Freemont street. If thats not hospitality Im not sure what is.  I would really like to go back for the Sweet Home Alabama which is their top seller but i dont think it will happen this trip...next time. Prices are excellent for the servings as well. No complaints for me- hidden away in the art district and way off the strip but about a mile from Freemont street. They do delivery as well! Worth the trip for some really Rock N'oodles.

I was hesitant to write a review for this spot. It's probably because I have a personal relationship with the owners. But I will never write anything false to bolster ratings. Anyways, Brien and Susan are a true inspiration. Lifers in the business with the most passion that you can truly taste it in the food. I am a big meatball fan and love all the dishes at RockN'oodles that incorporate them. The Great Balls of Fire and Asian wings are my two recommends. If you want to support a true mom-n-pop spot that has great food and passion, look no further. Keep on rockin you guys!

A friend of mine wanted to grab a quick bite before dance rehearsal. He texted me the address to this place and conveniently it was down the street from me. Right away I notice my friend inside this really cute and small place that only had like three tables. Right away an employee at the cash register greeted me. My friend had already order for us so our food didn't take that long. I had the "devil went downtown to Georgia". It was really good and spicy level was on point. Loved the music they were playing and even tho it was only my friend and I in there at the time I loved the vibe I was getting. Can't wait to come back again and try something new.

It's hard to review a place from one experience and on only one dish.  The dish was the Buffalo Soldier.  It's essentially a blue cheese mac 'n cheese with buffalo chicken on top.  The reason it gets 5 stars is because despite the fact that it wasn't super busy and in fact, by the time I got my food, I was the only one there, and despite the fact, I am not the demo who lives in and around the area so am obviously there for the first time, the service was great and not overwhelming.  The chef greeted us and offered that he can make whatever, however we want it, and the wait staff offered helpful advice when torn between the Buffalo Soldier and another dish.  So...based on the one dish, the pasta was not overdone (big deal if you are a pasta shop, right?), and the flavors were really balanced, which is hard and tempting to overdo, especially on a buffalo and blue sort of plate.  I finished the order (with some help from my "not really hungry" husband), and was left with a great impression.  Will definitely revisit when in the area and in the mood for pasta.  Nice work, guys!
Great place to eat and love the music they play while you are enjoying your meal. Friendly and helpful staff.
Unique names to match their flavors!  Quick service and a friendly staff....make sure to check out the desserts, fat bottom girls are to die for!

Part of what makes Yelp so exciting, at least for me, is finding places that I might not normally hear about. Rock 'N'oodles is definitely one of those good finds! I don't live or work anywhere near downtown and would have probably never seen it otherwise. It's a small building right off Charleston on 3rd Street that would be easy to miss if you were driving by. The restaurant itself is very small and can only seat about 12 people plus a couple outside tables. I love the décor though, it's simple but awesome with an entire wall covered in great albums they've got in really cool little frames.

When it comes to the food, you'll quickly realize why it's called Rock 'N'oodles. All the dishes are named after songs like Great Balls of Fire, Californication & The Devil Went Down To Georgia, just to name a few. Two of the ones we've tried so far now are Buffalo Soldier and Sweet Home Alabama...which I can only describe as versions of mac 'n cheese on steroids! The Alabama is a gouda macaroni topped with popcorn chicken and BBQ sauce with some bacon and onions tossed in. With the Buffalo Soldier you get blue cheese macaroni with carrots and celery topped with buffalo chicken. Now, like I said...steroids! Flavor is spectacular in both, pasta is cooked perfectly and each bite just keeps you wanting more! 

I've noticed some reviews mention small portions. I can only assume the owner/management are paying attention because these are definitely not small plates. We've also tried Born On The Bayou and Paradise City...I was only able to finish my entire plate once. On top of that, the customer service is great and even after my son accidentally spilled his Sprite all over the counter, we were met with smiles and a friendly attitude! Prices aren't bad either, with the most expensive dish coming in at about $12. This is a must try spot!
Fresh and fast! Great service and quality food. I'm particularly fond of Nights in White Satin and Space Oddity, but everything I've had has been nothing short of excellent.

I love that you can order half or full so that you can enjoy salad and pasta.  I had the short rib pasta and seasonal salad special with strawberries. Staff is very friendly and helpful!!!!  Great food and laid back vibe.  A plus was looking over all the records album covers hanging on the wall I had when I was a kid!
Awesome food, great downtown location, beer and wine, they do take out. Also brand-new expanded dining room, come down and see

They've expanded their seating area to the building next door! Now there's much more room to enjoy their AMAZING selection of noodles. Literally every dish is so good. I've been here 4 times and get something different each time. They never disappoint.

Ordered pick up of three dishes, all selected by checking out the website. Buffalo soldier, devil went down to Georgia, and sweet home Alabama. The most enjoyed was devil went down to Georgia. All were good, but I didn't care for the raw onion in SHA. The chicken and shrimp portions were great with the noodles. Overall, cool little spot with a great concept and nice staff.
