I got their spaghetti & meatballs and the sauce was delicious! However, the meatballs were a little dry and course. Nice size but I would've preferred a softer and juicier texture.

4.5! The decor, the service, and the food are all amazing. 

Know that it's a small spot so I definitely wouldn't recommend bringing your whole squad and their mom all up in there, but I must say they do offer some of the best tasting pasta I've had in awhile. Pretty unique as well. I love how they have that guessing game with the song lyrics. I'd cheat though so I decided to just buy the drink haha. Everything on the menu seriously sounds too good. I actually shed a tear because I wanted to try them all, but I guess it just gives me a reason to come back! I ended up picking the Devil went to Georgia and I didn't regret one freakin' bite. 5/5 The pasta was cooked a perfect al dente and every part of that bad boy was spicy and tasted of fine, fine quality. Definitely a bang for your buck on the freshness level of ingredients and the sizing of the portions. The garlic bread only had a minute appearance. After that it was inhaled 5/5. Only thing that was a little lackluster was the cheesecake 3/5. Something about the flavor or the texture was def off but I'm coming back to try those cream puffs. Mark my words. I really might just have to bring the whole squad and my momma too though, shoooo. Love that board supporting all the local businesses and events as well. Such a sucker for those! Definitely gonna hit the third Thursday burlesque bingo with the $3 shots. I'll have to tell you more later :)

This place is rocking...from the food to the music. A perfect spot for the art district and close to the renovated downtown. Inside seat ten and the outside seat eight so its great to eat outside and enjoy the weather when the weather is nice. 

I am a music lover so I really enjoy the rows of album covers on the wall--ranging from Lionel Richie to Queen to Michael Jackson to Amy Winehouse. The name of the dishes are song titles which I found cleaver. And as you are enjoying your food, at the same time your are listening to classic rock music that you will love.

It will be difficult to pick an entree because everything sounds delicious and is delicious but whatever you pick you will definitely enjoy.

Great food, great music, great place.

Food was great.. Had the BBq Mac and cheese and the ray of light... The bbq Mac and cheese was my absolute favorite! Just amazing! The chef was taking orders.. Cooking the food... Bringing out the food... Clearing the table... And washing dishes... As a chef I totally respect him! Would definitely go again.. Just a heads up though....the place is very small. Capacity is 14 inside and there's 2 tables outside. But don't let that stop you! If you have to do take out because it's packed. Well do take out!

I love all things pasta, so I knew as soon as I saw this place on Yelp, I had to go immediately. I saw on Yelp that it can get busy, so I came at an off time around 2:30 pm on a weekday. There was plenty of parking and half of their tables were open. Seating is small- there are a couple of tables outside and 5(?) tables inside. The Red Red Wine was delicious! The pasta was cooked perfectly. Say yes to the garlic bread! I regret that I got a half portion. I should have gotten a whole portion!!!!! The prices are super reasonable. They also play an awesome mix of music inside!!!!!

Cheap eats done well! I'm glad the 18b has a new affordable eatery. My first trip was suggested by Derek Stonebarger of Atomic Liquor/Theatre 7 fame, so I dove right in with the Buffalo Soldier, which was like awesomeness in a dish. Creamy, blue cheesy (but not too strong) shells topped with buffalo chicken and garnished with shredded celery and carrots? All that was missing was Monday Night Football and a beer! I took my cast of "Chalk Boy" over after a rehearsal and we each had different plates. What I've learned is this: it ain't fine dining, but it's affordable and tasty as hell. The only caveat is the limited seating. I know the day's gonna come when they get so popular that you won't be able to grab a chair...

I went to Rock n Noodles this evening for the first time and based on this experience and the awesome food I will definitely be returning. I was greeted by David who promptly took my order. The menu is all based off classic rock songs as is the decor of the place. Take your pick and I don't believe you'll go wrong. My wife went with "Sweet Home Alabama" and I decided on a simple "On Top of Spaghetti" under the kid's menu. Don't count out the kid's menu: it's a good portion of food. David even threw in extra condiments and free garlic bread. The wait was under ten minutes for two meals. Food was fresh, filling and service was outstanding! Thank you David and Rock n Noodles for a great first experience! We will definitely be returning customers!

You can tell that lots of care and attention was put into our dishes. The dishes we ordered were unique and BURSTING with flavors that combined amazingly! Lots of unique options on the menu and the desserts were amazing! There were two of us so we split two dishes (Sweet Home Alabama & Californication) and tried the soup of the day (Vietnamese beef pho - and yes they did nail it!) and an iced tea ($40 with tip). I'm glad downtown is getting more creative amazing restaurants! This is a place I would take a friend or out of town guest. The dining area is EXTREMELY small, takeout may be a great option here too. A large group would have a problem here. There are a couple of high small tables outside with heat lamps when it's cold. 

PROS: Sweet home Alabama (the mix of flavors were amazing)
             Hazelnut chocolate dessert mini cake
             FRESH FRESH FRESH ingredients
             Talented chefs

CONS: Dining room area is very small

I discovered this gem a couple of months ago while searching yelp for something close by the dental school to have lunch. They have an awesome menu that caters to a variety of tastes. I have now been there 4 times and have brought a friend with me each time. They are now huge fans also. The price is reasonable, the food is high quality, and the portions are more than enough.

Julie has been at the register every time I have been there and she is a sweetheart. If there is a problem with anything, she will make it right.

A lot of hype has been attached to the new restaurants opening up Downtown, but to be honest a lot of it is just  that: hype. It's hard for me to get excited about paying $20 for a $10 meal I could get at a Station Casino, just because it's being served on a fancier plate in a snootier setting. Fortunately, Rock'N'oodles bucks this trend by offering great food, generous portions and reasonable prices in a fun atmosphere.

Everything I've tried here has been amazing: from the Sweet Home Alabama (smoked gouda mac n cheese with buttermilk-fried popcorn chicken, bacon and homemade BBQ sauce) to the Asian wings and pork tacos. Everything is made fresh, and the portions are definitely Pulsar-sized. The house-made cream puffs are crazy addictive.  

R'N'N isn't just my new favorite Downtown restaurant. It's my new favorite restaurant, period.
Casual ambience, delicious food, with a wide variety of tastes (different flavor principles). Both full and half-size portions accommodate diners with large and smaller appetites.
The place is small and super cute we got 4 different dishes and everyone was amazing I will be back to try more

I love love love this tiny little place!

I come here for the unique musically inspired food, and am lucky if I get a seat as there are only four tables inside and two outside. Note: you can get your food to go or delivered if you are close by.

Do you like pasta?  If so, and you can branch away from the norm then please come here and try this locally owned, cleverly cool place.

They are known for da noodles but actually serve salads, wraps, and tapas too. I have tried 8 items and been surprised I liked them ALL. 

At the end of the day though, I am a sucker for the Sweet Home Alabama... honestly can't go wrong with pasta, bacon, Gouda, bbq sauce, red onions and popcorn chicken....yuuuuuummmmy!!!

They serve half and full orders. So you can choose how stuffed you want to be when you leave.

Parking is limited as there are only 4 spots behind building. If you go for lunch, best to go before noon.

I am hoping the owner gets to expand as I think it will be worth it! I'm still trying to figure out how to "steal" their album cover wall and put it in my house!!!

Holy gluten free noodle heaven! By far, the best gf noodles I've ever had. They were almost like a pappardelle noodle. I told chef David to make me something good that was dairy, nut, and gluten free and he did not disappoint! Andy tried the wings and they were delicious too! 

Rockn Noodles is located on the corner of Charleston and 3rd. It's a great location especially when you're going downtown for the night. It's a pretty tiny restaurant so I could see it getting pretty packed. They have a beer and wine selection too! 

Can't wait to go back. Thanks Chef David for making us such a delicious meal!

I have been here three times and can't wait to go back. Each time I have tried something different and I have yet to find something I didn't love. They are great for a quick bite before a show or for to go on the way home afterwork. I love the small local feel and like I said the food is amazing and priced right. I highly recommend the sweet home Alabama and the wrappers delight but honestly you can't go wrong with anything you order. Both my husband and three year old son love this place, for me that's a win!

Holy cow this place is DELICIOUS! I had 4 pasta dishes and these amazing Asian wings. Each dish is bursting with flavor. This restaurant is now one of my faves and they even have happy hour from 3-6. I would most definitely recommend that you come here. Also, very affordable so you can try multiple items on the menu.
Great people behind the counter.  They take a lot of pride in their food.  Had the Turning Japanese and it was perfect.

I would recommend the buffalo soldier, sweet home alabama, one night in bangkok and everybody wang chung tonight. They are different yet really good. (make sure you park across the street by the law firms)

Very delicious & lots of awesome varieties & options.  I would suggest calling ahead.  If you plan on hanging out is very small. They took a while because they weren't prepared for the dinner rush,  but it was definitely worth it.  
Big portions at very reasonable price & filling.
Cute place right by downtown in the arts district. Pasta was delicious, good prices and chill vibe. Will definitely go back when there's entertainment!
Awesome food and music with great service. I couldn't have asked for more...  I will be back when u visit Las Vegas again!!!

The food here is outstanding (recommend the Turning Japanese).. and the service even better. Chef David stayed open late when we showed up just before close and couldn't have been more welcoming. If I didn't live on the other side of the continent, I'd be a regular for sure!

Leaving the outlets looking for exactly this kind of place, a great local spot. The owner was working the register and was super friendly. The food was delicious a little something for everyone, salads all different kinds of noodles, small plates of tacos and fried pickles. Super cool vibe great music and walls covered in records. We've been at the hard rock so it was almost an extension of our stay. We will definitely stop back in before going back home

They have some real unique pasta dishes that are interesting even if they aren't perfectly done. I had my eye on the tikka masala themed Bang-a-Gong. 

Now first of all, finding this place at night is a bit intimidating. The streets around here are noticeably empty, and the parking lot is hardly that. The store is tiny with only a couple of people working.

That being said, they put together some creations that you'd have trouble finding anywhere else. The Bang-a-Gong ended up being like eating tikka masala with rice at an Indian restaurant. The orzo was okay, if not a big overcooked. I think it needed some more spice and overall punch in the flavor.

The guys here are cool and I can see it being a popular place for a quick bite if you live in the area. I wouldn't call it a place worth traveling to though.

OMG!!!!!  This cute little place is amazing!  First let's talk about the service my friends and I received from the first step in the door!  Awesome!  The cashier and hostess Julie was sweet, knowledgeable and so helpful when it came to us ordering our dishes.  Since I only eat seafood I was immediately told they could adjust any dish to accomodate me and that was done without a charge!!!  
We ordered the White Satin which was amazing, I had the Sweet Home Alabama with seafood instead of chicken and let me tell you Mac and cheese with shrimp and bbq sauce never tasted so darn good!!!!  We also got the Rapper's Delight, Cheese cake and Fried Pickles...Everything and I do mean every single bite was DELICIOUS!!!  All the food is made to order so you aren't getting noodle dishes that are just sitting in the back already prepared.  I highly recommend this cute little spot!!!

Cool hole in the wall spot near downtown vegas . 

Seems like the owner took our order and brought food to us . There was Rock and roll playing on the speakers (obviously ) which is cool . The service was good . You order at the front counter and they bring food to you. 

The fried mushrooms were really good and  came with an aioli. We added a a side of marinara which was a better option . We also  had the Mac and cheese pasta which was a good dish 


The problem is there are so many restaurants in Vegas . We had just happened to be driving and dropped into this place . Would we be back? Not sure because of other options . Maybe if we lived closer we would stop in again . The food was good but not great . I like to support places like this though . 
.

Some coworkers and I were looking for a new place to try for lunch and I found this place on Yelp.  We were taken aback by how small the storefront is, but it is actually much more spacious than it appeared from outside. The menu has a wide variety of choices which can appeal to anyone except the most indecisive eater.  The one thing i noticed was all of the dish names had some element of a rock song in them.  This goes along well with the album covers adorning the walls by the counter as well as the LPs covering the wall in the dining area.  I had the Mr. Roboto which was Kung Pao chicken with chow mein...and garlic bread.  The food was awesome but my only complaint is the noodles were just a little too chewy.  It had good flavor, was warm and tasted great.

I can't wait to try some other dishes from their menu.

Friendly service, delicious food and a commitment to the craft. My favorites are the Born on the Bayou jambalaya with orzo pasta and the Great Balls of Fire spaghetti. Take it to go or have it delivered.
5star's... Excellent. Ceviche n Shrimp, Wind Beneath my Wings!!!!! One Night to Bangkok!!!

Wir waren überrascht als wir ankamen...man ist nämlich ein ganzes Stück abseits vom strip! Unser essen war wirklich Lecker hatten zu den Nudeln auch einen salat;) vor allem preis leistungsmäßig vertretbar und für den kleineren Geldbeutel wirklich drin! Die Musik war dann natürlich noch ein i-tüpfelchen, mal andere Musik! Als die, die im radio oder am strip dauernd rauf und runter läuft!!

I got these Kung Fu fish Tacos and them Tacos was the truth. Loaded with Flavor. They come 3 at a time. The sauce is what did it. Cool little place. Not a lot of seating but very friendly environment and the music is enjoyable. If you is hungry and you is in Vegas and you is in the art district hit up is Rock N Noodles. Thumbs is up.

It's obvious that deep thought was put into every aspect  of Rock 'N' oodles.

I saw the reviews here on YELP for Rock 'N' oodles. Shared them with the wife and we agreed to give the place a try.

Very small place on the southwest corner of Charleston and 3rd steet. I only mention this because the place is THAT small. Inside are a few tables, that seat up to 14 people. Outside are two other tables that can seat 8 more people, if you litteraly want to eat on the sidewalk. We arrived 15 minutes after they opened for business. By 12 noon the place was packed!

But what Rock 'N' oodles lacks in size, you gain in service! The lady at the front counter was polite, helpful explaining the menu. When she noticed me trying a hot sauce with my meal she offered a few others, and explained why she was offering those. On to the food....

My wife had "Buffalo Soilder" which on the menu is descibed as a creamy blue cheese macaroni topped with boneless buffalo chicken pieces with julienned carrots and celery.

I had some "Sweet Home Alabama" a creamy smoked gouda macaroni and cheese tossed with purple onion and bacon. Topped with buttermilk marinated popcorn chicken and a swirl of barbecue sauce.

My wife says her meal was a bit on the extrea creamy side, almost like a soup. I agreed that mine was the same way. Her Buffalo chicken was great, but a little too spicy for her, so I ate the last few bites for her. 

My meal was good but I think I could have used some more spices on the chicken.

We also had an order of "Smells Like Teen Spirit", described as crispy french fries tossed in fresh herbs and parmesan, served with chipotle aioli. They were fine.

The decor in this place, in my opinion, is number one with a bullet! A wall complete with nothing but record albums. As I looked at each and every album, I would say BINGO to any performer I have seen in concert. Just a fun game my wife and I play when we are driving and listening to the radio.

Quotes written on the walls. A collection of hot sauce on display that people can use for their meals. I tried the Jimi Hendrix, Purple Haze sauce. It was okay. Even a selection of magazines for people to look at.

The food was okay at best, the decor and service was the best. Again it is obvious that deep thought was put into every aspect. I highly recomend Rock 'N' Oodles and hope to see them in a larger location one day, they deserve it!

Great local spot! Sweet home Alabama and bread is excellent! 
If you are in the downtown area and want a tasty treat

Yum!  I thought I was in the mood for a rare beef noodle bowl.  I called several places on Yelp and I  ended up trying this place.  We had garlic fries as an app and I had the beef wine dish.  Sorry I don't have the names down, they are creative and there's an LCD w/photos.  They serve beer and a local root beer in their offerings.   Happy "little" surprise in the arts district.   Not a cheap bite, but worth every cent.

if you like pasta, this is the best place you should go. various pasta choices, price are friendly. i personally recommend the night in white satin! the fries are fresh and delicious as well. nothing to complain.

The quality of food and value you get from this place is unparalleled by most establishments I've been to. Not only is their buffalo Mac and cheese absolutely delicious but the portions are plenty and the prices are great! I also ordered their jambalaya but couldn't even touch it I was so stuffed. Their pasta is tasty too. The only problem is their location which is a hole in the wall joint in the middle of nowhere. They need to get one in Henderson at some point! The workers are also super friendly. One of them even gave me and my friend a tour of their kitchen. Love this place

We came here for lunch solely based upon the Yelp ratings/recommendations. Tough to make a selection as everything on the menu sounded tasty. Ordered the Turning Japanese dish, it was hands-down the best Asian dish I've ever had! Minutes from downtown, but a hidden gem. Will definitely return!

Located in the heart of the Art District, Rock'N'oodles is one of the best hidden gems in Downtown. My options were always so limited when I had a pasta craving, but now I've found my go-to spot. 

The dishes here are packed full of flavor and creativity. It reminded me of a homier, more affordable version of Cheesecake Factory pasta plates. The half portions allow you to indulge in more than one plate if you want to mix it up. I love gouda so I tried the Sweet Home Alabama, which is mac and cheese in creamy gouda topped with bacon, onions, and popcorn chicken drizzled with barbecue sauce. I loved every bite.

For a cold noodle dish, I tried my friend's One Night in Bangkok, which is their take on Thai rice noodles with chicken. The noodles were cooked spot on and I loved the sweet chili sauce. If that isn't spicy enough for you, try the Nights in White Satin - the red pepper really gives a kick in your mouth. Enjoy some classic 80s rock while consuming your meal. Don't forget to ask for a piece of garlic toast!

Had lunch here today and everything was fresh and delicious. Staff was super relaxed and  friendly.  Food was great.... the reviews are on point.
We had chicken and pork tacos and  fries

Great place and great experience. The portions were good-sized and the prices are very reasonable. I also had the pleasure of meeting the owner, who was super cool and open and answering all of our questions. Overall a great, hidden away place. A must try.

I want to LOVE this place but I can't quite give it a full five stars. If it were based on concept, they'd get it hands down all day but each time I've eaten here there's been a semi-serious issue such as noodles completely floating in sauce that kinda ruins it for me. However, the food does have awesome flavor, and the whole dtlv hipster vibe is unique and intriguing. With as much attention to detail with the food as has been applied to the details of the business itself, I really think they'd be golden.
Ordered take out Marrakesh Express, Walking on Sunshine and Bang a Gong.  Everyone enjoyed their dish. Will be going back for more.

First time here and I got a great first impression! I was stuck between having the "Sweet Home Alabama" or the "Buffalo Soldier". I ended up getting the Sweet Home Alabama and I was not disappointed. The food is amazing, and their service is great. I ordered my food to go and it was ready right when they said it would be, definitely look forward to going back.

Ordered the Sweet Home Alabama noodle and Space Oddities fried pickles. Got it delivered free with Postmates app! Perfect way to end a hard workday. Noodles were hot and perfect. Fully cooked through, delicious robust flavors. You must get your fix using Postmates delivery app asap!
Must try "Nights in White Satan "  best noodles downtown. The set up inside is so awesome with vinyl records  , and very welcoming when you walk in  .
Wow... Just when I thought Brio was it for Italian cuisine. This is a game changer! Great flavors and great service!! 5 stars!

Awesomely strange concoctions of noodles and sauces. Tiny location, but comfortable table tops. Loved it. Serves good beer. Half order would have been plenty!

Owner or manager (not sure) is very friendly as well as their entire staff. A new must stop for me.

I have now eaten at this place three times, and each was as good as the last.  I always order take out, and the food is ready in 10-15 minutes (perfect for a busy schedule).  The menu is interesting and, at first glance, the combinations seem downright strange.  But something about it really works.  The flavors are outstanding and the portion size is just right.  The staff is also very friendly and the restaurant itself, while small, has a cool vibe.  This is a perfect spot for lunch downtown.

Was looking forward to trying Rock 'N'oodles and it didn't disappoint. Ordered the Buffalo Soldier and it was great. Very unique version of mac & cheese. I also enjoy spicy food and it had the perfect heat level. They also give you a siriacha ranch dipping sauce for the chicken that adds an extra touch. Looking forward to trying more noodle creations.

Blue cheese macaroni? You had me at blue baby. And it made me far from blue. All the happy!
Guy at the counter was great. We came in before a Rancid concert, and he complimented my Rancid shirt. As we sat, the music playing in the place changed to Rancid. What a guy.

What a great find! Every variety of noodle from Asian to Mexican, American, etc. The dishes are decadent and reasonably priced. We ate at their location and had them deliver to Hop Nuts. Both times the dishes were great.

If you love noodles and rock music this place is for you!  I needed a quick dinner before heading over to a show at the Bunkhouse and I've always had this place bookmarked.  Luckily made it about 45 mins before closing, I ordered the Bang a Gong which was a tiki masala dish with sautéed spinach served over orzo pasta.  This was good!  The only thing I would've preferred was a little more spice, but they had a whole array of hot sauces and pepper/chili flakes near the register which I used.  The dining area is small with (2) two tops and (2) 4 tops inside and a few tables outside for dining.  I think this place is great if you don't know what type of food you want or if your dining with someone who is in the mood for 1 thing while your in the mood for another.  I am usually always in the mood for Asian dishes or anything with rice, so when I read the Bang a gong, I was sold!  You can order a 1/2 or full portion, but since we were just looking for a light quick dinner we ordered the full and shared it.  The portion was perfect.  Your order also comes with garlic bread an good variety of music plays over the speakers while you eat your noodles.  The service was quick and friendly, the food was good, the record album covers on the walls are cool and the the prices are fair.  I want to come back an try them all!

First time here and I will be back.  Menu is incredible, entrees creative, fresh and soooo tasty.  Seating is limited so either take out or call ahead.  Tried Sweet Home Alabama and Ray of Light.  Both were fantastic!

Dang! I decided on a whim to try this place on my lunch break and I am so happy I did.

First off, they have tons of variety. If you want to come to with a group of people and don't necessarily want pasta, they have plenty of options to choose from. The pasta types have such an incredible range of flavor profiles. You could have anything from an upgraded Alfredo style pasta to a pasta with truffle oil, lemon, cream with perfectly cooked shrimp. 

The place is small right off of third and Charleston. It has a small parking lot but there is plenty of street parking available. When you walk in, you really feel the "rockn" vibe. There are records on the walls with some cool paintings. You order at a walk up counter(sometimes it's nice to not worry about having a server!).

I ordered the nights in white satin and it was so stinking delicious! I will definitely come back for this creamy, tangy shrimp dish! 

If you're in the area, I highly recommend it!!!

Went here for lunch one day.  The place had a bit of inconvenient parking and the place was small and full of customers.  I asked where we could sit and the manager set up tables and chairs outside.

I got the Buffalo Soldier mac-n-cheese (no bleu cheese) with chicken.  OMG!  It was great!  I didn't have desserts but there was an awesome selection.  I'll definitely be back!!!

Greeters - N/A
Wait staff/counter - 4 Stars (courteous)
Food - 5 Stars
Dessert - N/A
Ambiance - 3 Stars (limited seating indoors...no problems today, it was cool outside)
Pricing - $ 1/2

Overall - 4 Stars

Delicious pasta! All the sauces are made from scratch. I went during happy hour (buy one get one beer or wine) but you have to get the same exact drink for both. Loved it here! It is such a cute little hole in the wall in a not so populated area! They need to expand and get more menu items without meat! They did substitute out the meat for tofu though and it was so tasty. The desserts I had were lemon (topped) cheesecake and lemon cakes. The cheesecake was slightly thick but that's nothing a good thaw won't fix. The lemon cakes were $1 and super delicious! Highly recommend!!! And the worker there-I'm assuming was the manager-was totally gay and totally sexy. Mmmmmm momma almost gave him my number, but I'm not a local so I just stared in lust imagining being his wife one day... Just sayin
Cute and trendy with a friendly staff. The food was unique, and overall good but not necessarily great. My favorite was the fried pickles (Space Oddity).

This is what a small business should be! We walked from downtown to the restaurant and it was worth every single step!! We ordered Sweet Home Alabama, Knights in White Satin, Great Balls of Fire, two orders of butter noodles (for the kiddos) and the fries. Ok everything was amazing! Let me start by saying they saved a seat for us after we called in. After I ordered I went to pay and my bank put a hold on my account as I'm vacationing and they were making sure there was no fraud. Ok so the great folks at Rockin Noodle were prepared to give us the meal for free!!!! Pure class! After the bank called me to ensure I wasn't robbed everything was good so I paid and this is when I was told they were going to take care of our check. Awesome people here!! Ok so food was epic, we were leaving waiting for a cab and they gave the kiddos a bottle of water and brownies to go!! Seriously it's so nice to see the generosity these days, in a place like Vegas where everything cost money, these guys are top notch! Definitely worth a trip peeps please go show these guys some love!

Californication and the ray of light pasta entrees both blew me away! Great flavors, wide variety of pasta and flavors to choose from but the thing that stands out the most are employees! Completely accommodating and extremely helpful, made sure we knew everything we needed to order and even sent us home with a couple menus (they also serve breakfast) we will definitely be back and probably end up getting takeout at some point!
Hole in the wall restaurant that picks a punch with great noodle/pasta dishes. My favorite has been the "Sweet Georgia Brown" Mac and cheese with smoked Gouda and topped with popcorn chicken!

Wow, there aren't enough adjectives to describe the food. We had the Devil Went Down to Georgia,  Paradise City, and  White Riot +chicken. This became a family favorite as soon we took our first bite. 

The atmosphere is wonderful, although there are only a few tables inside and a couple more outside.  Their Playlist is epic and beer and wine selection are simple but adequate. BOGO happy hour is an added bonus.

Whether you are a local or out of towner, do yourself a favor and hit this place up.

Ordered delivery and the food got to me within 30 minutes! The food was a little expensive but worth the price. I had the buffalo chicken pasta (can't recall the exact name) and the New Orleans pasta (can't recall the exact name)  they were both really good! I would order from here again
Nice enough service, but both dishes we ordered lacked flavor. The Everybody Wang Chung was extremely salty. The food was hot, but that was about it.

Really delicious.  Very much looking forward to trying everything. Based on what I had (Bang a Gong), if the rest if the menu comes close this little spot is a real winner. 

Good portion, good price, superb flavor.

Downtown Las Vegas keeps getting better, especially with this place!  Rock 'N'oodles is tucked away, so it might be a little hard to notice if you're just driving by.  I came on my lunch break with a friend after they delivered a menu to our office.

My first thought walking in was how clean this place is.  You can smell the food from outside!  It is smaller inside, but not small on flavor.  I ordered the Buffalo Solider and two Fat Bottom Girl crème puffs with chocolate ganache.  AMAZING!  The food was 100% as well as the customer service.  This is definitely going to be a regular place for work lunches as well as weekend lunches while I'm out shopping at the unique boutiques down here.
Pretty cool place to have a bite!  From the albums on the walls, to the cool art painted on the wall, the food is freaking good!!! Earned every star!

Not a terrible experience. They have a very interesting menu. Some of their noodles are Italian, Asian, and other varieties. It gets uncomfortably packed around lunchtime, which will likely improve as the weather gets better. If you work or live in the neighborhood, you should give this place a try.

The wife and I have driven by this spot numerous times and finally got a chance to try the food here. Not sure how many ways I can say this...the staff and food are awesome, amazing, fabulous, and yummy. 

This will spot will now be in heavy rotation. I advise everyone to come downtown and try this gem.

I liked it.  The dishes were freshly made. It's a one man band and I love small local businesses.  I'd rather wait a few extra minutes and take care of some things on my own just to support a local entrepreneur. Parking is a dilly and beer selection limited,  but the noodles are rocking.

I really wanted to like this place but it was disappointing. The dishes I tried were Ray of light and The Devil Went Down to Georgia.  Pasta in the first dish was inconsistent in texture and color, as if some of the noodles had been sitting there longer than others. TDWDTG is supposed to be topped with jumbo shrimp. Did they really mean a single shrimp because I barely got more than one. The sauce was also a little runny and bland, with hardly any depth of flavor except the spiciness of the chipotle sauce. I expected a lot more for 13 bucks. 

Saving grace was the cream puff. Both the regular one and the chocolate covered are excellent. 

I will probably be back at some point since there is not much choice around this area. Maybe I didn't pick the right dish, maybe they had a bad day, but certainly the cream puffs are worth another visit.

Fresh food can't be rushed. We started with the fried pickles, which came out hot and well seasoned. Our other dishes also came out piping hot and perfectly seasoned.
Awesome soundtrack for the whole meal, too.
Second time and we still love it. Services is friendly and food delicious.  Pasta is made when you order. Happy hour 2-6 buy one beer and get a second one free. Will definitely be back.

I discovered Rock'N'Oodles pretty much by accident. I hadn't been told about it or seen it on Yelp prior to being on that side of town and seeing what was nearby/sounded good. It wasn't on my radar. Anyway, we decided on pasta and off we went.

I, initially, felt like this place was on the small side because the counter is very close to the entrance & there are only a few 2 tops on that side & a few more tables on the other side. But, during my 2nd visit I realized just how big that other side was!! It can easily accommodate a decent size group. 

The service is excellent. The decor is casual and fun. Records and photos are fun to check out on the walls. The music playing is, also, pretty great.

Brien was at the counter. He was really helpful with answering our questions and making suggestions. All the dishes are named after songs, another fun nod to the music concept. Brush up on your song lyrics! If you can guess the artist & song title for the weekly mystery lyrics, you can win a free beverage, but I'm currently 0-2. You order/pay at the counter, sit where you like, and they bring it out to you.  We landed on Crazy Train & Livin' La Vida Loca.

Crazy Train is their version of chicken picatta, which is a favorite of mine. I thoroughly enjoyed this version. The pasta was cooked perfectly, the chicken was nice and tender, and the sauce was flavorful. And, unlike other versions, this Crazy Train was somehow light while still being filling.

Livin' La Vida Loca was fantastic!! A creamy Pepper Jack Sauce, Carnitas, Jalapeños, Pico, Black Beans...sort of like a Mexican Mac n Cheese, yet so much more. I want to explore the menu, but it will be hard not to order this every time. It is definitely the kind of dish I will get a craving for and go just for this.

On my 2nd visit here I switched things up and went for the Rapper's Delight. This was a generous sized wrap loaded with fried chicken, lettuce, cheese, siracha ranch, peppers, & onions. Served with fries. Another winner. My friends had Sweet Home Alabama, Ray of Light, Buffalo Soldier, Great Balls of Fire, Knights In White Satin, Walking On Sunshine, & Smoke On The Water. Every single person in a party of 14 raved about their food.

I love that most dishes can be ordered in a full or half portion. And, I really love the BOGO beer & wine during Happy Hour! Even though this is mainly a "noodle" place, the menu is diverse to accommodate whatever you might be in the mood for...American, Asian, Mexican, Italian, Greek. They have both hot & cold pasta dishes, salads, sandwiches, beer & wine, desserts. Something for everyone!

Prices are affordable. A  1/2 order is around $8 while a full portion is about $13. I almost want come here once a week until I've tried it all!! Please check them out.
Absolutely love this place. We've been coming here for the last 2 or 3 years. My husband and I would highly recommend the entree " sweet home Alabama " it's so delicious.

Love this place.  The plates are named after cool tracks from back in the day and decorated really cute with album covers on the walls.  The Devil Went Down to Georgia is one of my favorites and deliciously spicy!
Great noodles and tunes! Cheap and fast. Mostly a take out place. Very small dining area, but great nonetheless.

This place is a fabulous addition to an odd downtown neighborhood.  It is great for lunch.  Let's start with parking: rough!  If you are near downtown, just walk.  Otherwise, be prepared to park far away and walk.  When you go in, there are three or four tables, that's it.  You can sit outside, but we didn't see anyone doing that.  So, we ordered food to go.  The food was amazing and the people really take pride in good food and good customer service.  There is a lot of music memorabilia on the walls you can check out while you wait.  I didn't have any dessert like other yelpers have, but I will def be back to check it out.  Highly recommend.

Great lunch her with our 2 teenagers, very creative menu!  We ordered the half portions of turning Japanese, buffalo soldier, and paradise city & order of delicious wings.  Not crowded when we stopped for late lunch, parked onsite & ate inside.

A few of my friends and I walked into this place as first coming people, and immediately felt the friendly atmosphere. David greeted us and offered great specials on the food. We tried the Asian wings which were PHENOMENAL, just the right crisp to the bite. Then has to half pastas, the devil went down to Cergia and another red wine one which had the perfect amount of pasta and sauce. Very creamy to the taste. As well for decoration very fun if you are a music lover!!

Just wanted to check out a new spot in downtown and had this place bookmarked for a while. Finally got around to it and it wasn't busy for mid-afternoon on a Wednesday. 

We ordered a half order of Sweet Home Alabama and a full order of Great Balls of Fire. Portions wise it was great, a half order was just enough to fulfill the craving and the taste of the Mac n cheese with BBQ sauce and POPCORN chicken was a great combo! The chicken settled well with sweet BBQ taste. 

I like the selection on the menu, it's a variety of different things and it's a unique pasta place! This ain't no Mac Shack, it's a twist Mac shack! Definitely a good little hole in the wall type of place!

Amazing food!!  Sweet home Alabama didn't disappoint and neither did the Buffalo soldier!    Love that it is not on the strip and a fun cool spot!  Parking is very limited but totally worth hunting down a spot!

I fell in love with Rock'N'oodles today. And as much as I'd love to keep a restaurant like this to myself... I've decided that spreading the word will give them the credit they deserve.

Upon entering Rock'N'oodles is a wall of classic records you'll recognize (if you have good taste, LOL). It's a pretty small space, but regardless of that, it's set up well and decorated tastefully. The lighting is superb! The chairs aren't bad either--there are throw pillows for the booths. Oh, and the restroom is clean--that's an automatic thumbs up in my book!

Parking is limited, and it's separate from the Downtown Project and Fremont St. but it's only about a mile away, so if you are in the area for that, it won't be too much of a bother to head on over!

Now, for the food! That's the important part, right?! It's unfortunate for me to admit, but I've only had the sides here! My party had already eaten before exploring the downtown area and stumbling upon this joint. But when we entered out of curiosity and read the menu, we could not leave without ordering something.

The menu items are named after hit singles; we had the Space Oddity (beer battered pickle spears and sriracha ranch) and Smells Like Teen Spirit (fries with parmesan, herbs and a chipotle aioli). I've never had combinations like this before. They were both so delicious! I'm not big on condiments at all but these sides were worth the adventurous try! The chef served it to us and was incredibly polite. It was truly an awesome experience! 

My party and I have already decided to come back for a full meal! Definitely looking forward to trying the entrees and desserts!

This place is a very delicious destination if you want to go get a good plate of pasta and a bit of rock nostalgia. I ordered a "devil goes down..." though it wasn't as spicy as I would think, the flavor was all there and I could make it spicy with their selection of hot sauce. The employees were really nice and the homage to different idols of the 70's to 90's was great to look at. The art district I also feel is an appropriate for this little eatery since it adds to the atmosphere. Keep this place in mind when you are getting away from the Las Vegas strip.

Okay let's be honest. It's noodles. I mean really? Five starts for noodles? How can that be?

Well.....their combinations of flavors and textures make noodles, WOO-HOODLES!!

Oh, and did I mention the desert offerings aren't too shabby? (nor is the garlic bread!)

They keep this up, they will need a bigger place!

Rock'N'Noodles is one of the few downtown places that doesn't suck and deserves the 4 1/2 Stars Yelp has them currently rated at. From the outside it doesn't look like much and if you're not paying attention you could drive right past it. Parking? What parking? Good luck with that...but if you do get lucky and find a space step inside to a little spot with 4 tables and a very interesting menu that's packed with some interesting combinations and flavors worth exploring further. 

I've tried several items on the menu now, and Knights in White Satin is the one item I've ordered more than once. Also I have to recommend the Smells Like Teen Spirit fries...I was like a hungry teenager and left none of them behind. 

Pricing...this isn't the cheapest lunch in town but I considered it priced right for the quantity and more importantly the quality of what they offer. 

4 Stars...it's not overrun by the hordes from Zappos, they offer delivery / call ahead ordering, and it's just a great place to eat downtown.

I really like this little hole in the wall noodle joint. They have a lot of interesting variety on their menu and take some cool liberties with their noodle dishes. There are definitely some things you can get here that you can't get elsewhere. The staff is always been very nice and if the line is long they make up for it.
Very good food and the delivery service was awesome... They delivered the the Classic Jewel Bar.. Thank you for the great service...

Nice friendly counter service.  I got the nights in white satin which was very good.  The man child got the BBQ Mac n cheese which was fantastic.  Both of us got 1/2 orders which was plenty for lunch.

Great Service and Atmosphere and great food.  The music in the background makes you want to play music trivia with the guests.  The menu is great with the titles of songs for food titles.  The place is small, so get there on an off time to get a seat as it does get busy.

Awesome little find in vegas. Get yourself a $12 Uber ride off the overpriced strip and go get yourself some creative and delicious dishes at this funky hole in the wall. Fantastic tunes and some noodle dishes that will wow the tastebuds. I had the ray of light, hubs had the going Japanese and both where legit.  The Asian wings where in the top 5 best for me. Combined up with 2 for 1 beers happy hour and you can't go wrong. Will be back next trip.
I've been searching for a pasta joint cause who doesn't love pasta. I ordered Paradise City and so happy that I did. We will definitely be regulars here when I get a pasta craving.

Really good and cheap! A bit too much lemon in this white satin! And two shrimps on the half order. Chicken could have been fried harder but flavor was amazing! Will def come back super cheap lunch and quick service

Tried this place as a referral from Cindy at the Funk House around the corner. I ordered the mac and cheese which was quite good. The serving was huge and I couldn't finish it all. The Mac had a more creamy sauce than unusually go for but was still very cheesy. The BBQ chicken on the top was a nice and crispy too. 

The owner was very nice and helpful when I asked for suggestions. He even offered to let me sample the soup of the day. 

Only down notes are that it has very limited space in their parking lot and it was slightly to noisy in there with the loud music and the TVs on. Even when I tried to sit outside to get out of the noise I sat right under some speakers. But I guess i should have expected that given the environment. :) 

**Will go here again with my gf and try the other selections.

I love this little place. And since their remodel they have a lot more space. Every time friends or family come to town I take them to my favorite little local spot, and that's here. Their food is always delicious, their atmosphere is rockin (pun intended), and the people are always so nice. There isn't much parking but that's just because of it's location. Now, if only they'd finish the construction on Charleston....it would be so much easier of a drive!

I'm a huge music nerd so with a name like Rock N Noodle and menu comprised of song titles I totally had to check it out. Plus my husband loves pasta. 

We first went with our good friends and fellow Yelpers Dyanna and Brent. After that time Joel and I both had agreed that we should have gotten what they had. So on a recent visit back we did! Since it was like 8:30pm and they close at 9pm we decided to take our order to go. Joel ordered the Sweet Home Alabama. It's like Mac and cheese had a baby with some barbecued chicken. He gobbled it up! And quickly said he couldn't wait to have it again. I ordered the Smoke on the Water salad and added chicken and also got the Wind Beneath My Wings. By the time we got home (since we live all the way in Henderson & they are on 3rd st) I was ready to tear open the bag. The smells coming from the brown bag were glorious! When I pulled everything out I found we were missing my wings. I was so sad. I quickly called Rock N Noodle and talked to Brian. He was very nice and apologetic. He just did not hear me when I ordered the wings. But he did say that when we come in next he will give me a free order! Very cool! Now the salad! Mmmmmm yummy! You have to try it! It tastes like a rib in a salad. But there are no ribs in this! Just lettuce, tomato, red onion, wonton crisps and avocado. I added chicken too! The dressing though! Wow! It just makes the salad. It has a smokey, spicy, Bbqing quality about the salad dressing. Like no other salad that I've had before.

I'll be back soon for my free wings and another salad. Wish we lived closer I'd be there every week. If your craving pasta and killer salads hit Rock N Noodle up!!

This place was just ok I thought. First, they were out of my first two choices. And then they were out of the wine we wanted to order. I ended up ordering the chicken tikka - forget the name - and it was pretty bland. The ratio of chicken to orzo was bad. I got a half order and it was like three cups of orzo and four tiny pieces of chicken. The concept is great, but needs some work.

Wasn't sure where to eat so I asked a "local" friend in the area. He highly recommended Rock'n Noodle.  Excellent choice!  A very creative menu. Lots of choices. I called ahead and placed my order. There's a very small parking lot in back to park while I ran in. It's a small place and super cool atmosphere.  I can't wait to go back again.

The fiance, friend and I wanted to eat lunch in the area and found our "usual" was closed for a repair so I busted out bookmarks and off we went. This spot does creative pasta toppings and has a Rock N Roll theme with the names and vinyls on the wall. Funny, but I heard not one rock song while there. It's a small spot with 4 tables so not really a place for a big family dinner. 

Even though we were given a table and menus, we were then told we have to get up and order and pay at the counter. It is a DIY drink fountain situation as well. 

The fiance and I shared: 

Sweet Home Alabama - this is a smoked gouda macaroni with bacon, onion, popcorn chicken topped with BBQ sauce. The flavor of this was pretty good, I did like the gouda cheese sauce, but it was sparse on the bacon as I got 2 bites where I noticed it. I'm all about don't put a sprinkle of something in a amount that doesn't do anything for the dish so either place a solid presence of bacon flavor or leave it out. The popcorn chicken was a bit over fried though as it was dark in color and dried it out.

Livin' La Vida Loca - pepper jack penne with carnitas, beans, pico and jalapeno on top. The carnitas topping is really good, nice flavor and tender but the pasta sauce was lacking in flavor and needed some seasoning as it was just straight cream. Our friend also got this. Both these were overly sauced as well. I like generous sauce but it looked like soup when all the pasta was picked out.

You get a garlic bread slice with each pasta and it was standard, but good. 

The pasta comes in two sizes- full bowl and half. We got the Sweet Home as a full and the Livin' as a half. I took a picture for comparison of the bowls. The small is deceiving as it's still a good portion. 

The place has potential. It's all in the execution details and little tweaks that can take it from "a'ight" to something solid good. I'll maybe give them another try at a later date.

Probably the best restaurant we went to in Las Vegas. My gf and I wanted to go to a more local and off the strip joint, and found this place on google. The restaurant is small yet spacious, but it was pretty empty when we went. 

We got the Ray of Light without any pancetta, even without the pancetta it was so delicious. The dish was rich in flavor without it being overpowering and the pasta was cooked just perfect. The only downfall was that we weren't hungry enough at the time to try out other menu items.

This will definitely be a stop next time we visit Las Vegas.
No delivery goes straight to mailbox. Very unprofessional to not even have number to call

Rock'N'oodles is a wonderful gem near Downtown Las Vegas!!!
I love the creativity of the pastas, not only do they make pastas from different cultural backgrounds they also name them after famous songs, it goes with the theme.

The pastas are scrumptious and made from scratch!
The portions are great for any appetite, full plate and/or half plate.
Occasionally, they will invent a new dish so it's good to follow them on social media.

The decor is very nice, they have plaques of famous music artists on the wall. 
Unfortunately, that was the only awesome thing to look at because the restaurant is small about 12 people at a time. They have seats outside but it's summer in Vegas right now, it's best to call ahead and confirm the waiting time. Parking wasn't difficult to find I just parked across the street.

The service was fine and the staff were friendly.

My favorite pasta: Born on the Bayou & The Devil Went Down to Georgia

Highly recommend!!

We just ate dinner at this new restaurant in the heart of the art district. The food and service was outstanding. The owner Brien came out and talked to us like we were family. The atmosphere is warm and cozy. We shared many wonderful dishes. We tried the "Ray of Light" penne pasta with spinach, pine nuts, and panchetta, delicious! We also had the "Sweet Home Alabama", "Everybody Wang Chung Tonight", "Bangagong", and "Born on The Bayou". They were all outstanding. Each dish was bursting with flavors. Chef Abby really outdid herself. We sampled her cream puffs and fruit tarts and have to say they were some of the best in Las Vegas. 

We can't wait to come back again. Check out the menu, you'll love it!
Great food! Very unique dishes, and each is executed very well. I had the knights in white satin and david had the one night in bangkok, plus an order of the fries. Highly recommend!

I crave this food. We've tried over half of the items on the menu and I haven't had a bad one yet. The owner Brian,  is adorable. The food is phenomenal. Crazy Train is my favorite. Bittersweet Symphony is the BEST Greek salad, and One Night in Bangkok is to die for. I highly recommend trying one of everything!

This place is fantastic!  We ate here during our family's vacation and all four of us loved the dishes we ordered.  I had the Knights in White Satin and it was great. It got better with each bite.  My husband ordered the Buffalo Soldier and really loved it. The heat is just right and the bleu cheese flavor perfectly complimented the dish. My sons ordered the specials and devoured it. The atmosphere and decor is pretty awesome too.  We will definitely come back again when we visit Vegas!

Called in a takeout order tonight & the process of ordering and going in to pick up was quick and painless. I could see parking being an issue for some, but that's just how it is downtown. Due to the small size of this place, I would probably only call in orders, but it's a really cute place. 

The food was good and something I would try again. The Sweet Home Alabama was spicier than I expected, which was nice, but not as cheesy as I'd hoped. My husband got the Great Balls of Fire and he thought that it was good and the meatballs had a nice kick to them.  

All in all, a good experience. As someone who lives and works downtown, it's nice to have a new place that isn't pizza and is quick and easy to get takeout from.
Food is unique & great. I've only gotten delivery from this joint. Brian has been the one to always bring my food. I like him a lot. 5/5

Great little place to frequent if in Vegas and need some great food and good on your spending budget. I had the Born on the Bayou (ok Jambalaya) and it was spot on from what I get in Louisiana.  The Chef will make it as spicy as you like it. While here we talked to him and he was friendly and happy to make sure we had a please take experience. 

One thing for sure, I will definitely be back here to try out the other great items in the menu.

First time experience was incredible, I had food delivered to Hop Nuts Brewery on Main, the order came fast, for $7.00 the food was what I'd pay $19 for in a fancy italian spot, quality was superb and the portion was great. They delivered for $2 while I sat and had my beer. I will definitely be ordering again.

I came. I saw. I noodled. 3 stars. Overhyped in my opinion. Basically, I could eat noddles just as okay at say, Applebee's.

Rock'n'noodles is a cute little spot in the Arts District. Serving up unique noodle dishes, wraps, and excellent baked goods. The place is tiny: two half booth-tables that seat 4 and two high tops that seat two or three. It's maximum capacity can't be more than 15. You go in, graze the menu, order and pay at the counter, and wait for the noodles to rock on out to you.

The dishes are cooked fresh to order, so there's a little bit of a wait before your food arrives, but it's a huge portion and it comes steaming and hot.They all have really cute names Nights in White Satin, Sweet Home Alabama, Livin' La Vida Loca, etc.

I went with two of my friends and we all ordered something different and we all shared. I was not really impressed. The flavors were okay, but nothing was really bold or stood out. It was good, but it wasn't that great. Nothing I would crave or would have me raving about town about. The menu is layed out funky. Everything is listed under Entrees and my one friend's dish came out as a wrap, so read carefully.

I heard the deserts were off the chain, my cupcake was okay, but I've had better (nothing has topped Retro Bakery for me) and my friend ordered a lemon bar. It didn't come out with our food and when he asked for it, they told him that someone had bought them out of them all, the owner was nice enough to replace it with a beer. 

Overhyped, underwhelmed.

First time here and what a Awesome place, 
Employees were very helpful, friendly and made us feel like home. 
I got the Sliders and will be back for sure.
Small 5 tables indoors and 2 outdoors so it's tiny. Located in the arts district, really cool spot. There's record sleeves decorated on the wall. Lastly everything I've tried, has been terrific.

Off the beaten path
One foot on the dash
Off the beaten path
Out where the good love grows and a couple great Cats have a dining experience that rocks! Thank you for beating to your own drum.

I ordered delivery from here and received it a short time after the order was placed. The shrimp noodle dish was piping hot as if it had just been prepared moments before. They don't skimp on the shrimp either! It was a large portion and executed beautifully. The noodles were al dente and the flavors were layered in rich garlic with bits of crushed red pepper. I had enough for two meals, and it was just as delicious when reheated. Can't wait to try more!

This is one of my favorite places to eat! I live right down the street and they have all different types of food. The best part is everything is named after a rock song. Actually the best part is everything is fresh and reasonably priced!
I love this place!! I will try everything on their menu soon enough lol
Try their Sweet Home Alabama. It's my all time favorite on their menu. (It's boss Mac & cheese!)
Fried pickles; yes! Honestly, though, their pasta is not very good. It's equivalent to food you'd get at a drive through.

As I have said in other reviews, the mark of a great place is consistency, yet again great pasta, sauces that cannot be beat and friendly service, this is a place that deserves the support of the whole Yelp community.

And again, the real secret star of the place, the chicken wings, they alone are worth the drive over on a stormy night.
Everything was excellent!! Had the Devil went down to Georgia and it rocked.  Highly recommended.  This is one of those places that insiders know about and love.

A tiny little place that serves noodles and other dishes with a punch of flavor.  4 tables inside.  All the dishes have theme names but who cares?  YUMMY.  Very nice owner.  Off the charts good stuff.

Top notch small venue. If you like great food and are tired of paying for ridiculously overpriced meals for subpar foods get out of the casino and come here. Even the kids menu food was good. Truly a hidden gem. We will make this a regular stop every time we come to Vegas,

Lots of flavor goin on here!!!  Had the Bang A Gong, their spin on tikka masala.  Wow, was it good!  Very aromatic with just a slight kick from the cayenne.  She had the Wang Chung, and enjoyed every morsel!  Our free desert(won by knowing the lyrics of the day) was a tasty lil chocolate tort with a peanut butter crust, topped off an excellent meal!  We also were impressed that the chef came out and greeted/checked on us after our meal.  Great lil place with great food.  We will be back to try other renditions of noodles!!

I was so glad to have stumbled upon this adorable noodle shop! I had bookmark this restaurant, but wasn't intending to eat here until I passed it on the deuce. It was very close to closing time when my friend and I got here , but the gentleman at the counter was very nice and didn't seem too bothered by our late arrival. My friend ordered a pasta dish with pancetta and asparagus that was light and springy. I ordered the beef bourguignon pasta dish that had a lot of flavor and perfectly tender beef. I love that they offer half portions. The half portion is on the small side but plenty for most people and reasonably priced at around $8. The garlic bread that came with the pasta was buttery and delicious. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting or living in Vegas.

It's both good and small, so be ready for both. We like independent kitchens and this restaurant was great to try while we were in town. The Las Vegas PD were picking up their to go order when we got there, so that was a good sign.

We tried two dishes, and each was just the right size for sharing. I had the Red Red Wine, which is braised beef short ribs with vegetables (hand cut). The noodles were cooked just right, and had just enough chewyness to mix with the other ingredients on my palate. We also tried the Nights in White Satin which is a tasty dish of linguine with mushrooms and jumbo shrimp. The truffle oil really didn't distinguish itself in this dish, and left us feeling like we didn't get to taste its full potential.

It's a rockin restaurant, so try to find your favorite album cover on the wall. Fans of the 70,s and 80's won't be disappointed.

I vaguely remember seeing somebody check in to this place months ago. My friend Maria A. suggested dinner Downtown at Container Park (100x NO) so I countered with this place on 6/19/14.

Definitely pleasantly surprised. Parking is horrible, and is surrounded by shifty looking apartments and other buildings that look like a 2nd world barrio. I ended up having to park at one of these apartments. 

I didn't realize how small this place was, so I am very happy we were able to grab a table. We both ordered the Sweet Home Alabama. She ordered hers sans bacon because she keeps kosher. I ordered mine "with her bacon" because I gave up kosher specifically to eat bacon. I don't know if the bacon is made into the sauce because I didn't see any on either of our dishes. 

She had a cream puff that she said was great and we split the brownie that I ordered. It was good. Maria ordered fries for us to split - they were pretty salty.

Anyway, back to the pasta. AMAZING. Really delicious. A full order is definitely enough for 2 meals, which is why I took half my food to go. Will definitely be back and... you know how much I hate giving anything higher than 3 stars, so you know you can trust this review.

This is one of our night go regulars. I love the wings and I have been going through and trying something new on every meal. I think I've tried 5 different items. Sometime I've just had to have something a second time .  It's a small little joint that doesn't have very many seats, so be prepared to be up close and personal.

I was expecting something delicious with the great reviews but was sadly disappointed.  My meal had absolutely NO taste.  I added salt,  parm cheese,  and squeezed three limes on top of it.  It was better but after 4 bites total,  I was done. The calories were definitely NOT worth it.  Ugh!!!

Walked in on Tuesday 3-15-16 at 5:20 PM to place an order to-go.  This restaurant is located on 3rd street just off Charleston.  The restaurant is decorated with old music albums and all the food has a cool music-related name.  I immediately got good vibes from the young man who took my order.  He was whistling the whole time he was helping make the food and seemed to genuinely enjoy his job.  I like that.  

$34.88 got me a "ray of light" pasta, a "rappers delight" wrap, a "bitter sweet symphony" salad, and a lemon bar.  Two delicious pieces of garlic bread, ketchup, some grated parmesean cheese, greek salad dressing, and some tasty sauce was included in the bag without me having to ask.  

$11.25 "Ray of Light" had penne pasta tossed with pancetta, pine nuts, asparagus, white wine and lemon juice, finished with a heaping handful of fresh spinach and parmesan cheese.  My eyes were bigger than my belly so I ordered the full portion and had a lot leftover.  The flavors were delicious and light.  I found the pasta to be a bit toooooo al dente for my taste and wish it had a little sauce but it was still mighty tasty.  

$8.50 "Bitter Sweet Symphony" salad is a traditional Greek salad with tomatoes, Kalamata olives, red onion, and feta cheese which is served with warm pita chips.  Their tangy vinaigrette was not my favorite but thank goodness it came on the side.  The romaine lettuce was fresh and crispy and there were lots of delicious toppings.  My favorite part was the pita chips on top which were undoubtedly deep fried yet chewy.  

It was ridiculously fast to get a to-go order (about 10 minutes) and it's right on my way home from work so this is dangerous.  I'll definitely be back to try all of their dishes!!!!

Their wings are off the chain!!!! 

Everything is pretty unique, fresh, and tasty but my all time favorites are:
- crazy train noodles 
- buffalo soldiers noodles
- wind beneath my wings 

Their desserts are pretty spectacular too!!!

A little disappointing. Unfortunately they were out of greens, so I couldn't get the smoke on the water salad; they switched to a special pasta with veggies (I think I overpaid by a dollar since the pasta was cheaper than the salad). The pasta was ok, nothing special--cooked more on the al dente side, with a fairly basic flavor profile. I don't think the choice of veggies added much to the favor. Overall, a forgettable dish. The service was friendly, which was appreciated.
Love it. Great place to eat and chill! They play amazing music and the vibe in there is just so friendly and all around amazing

This is such a cute place to go! If you're a music lover, it's a must stop! The walls are covered in album covers and song lyrics from a large variety of rock songs! The menu is awesome, everything is a nice spin on classic items and they are all named after rock songs. It's adorable and super fun! 

The portions are large - so a half is definitely okay! Or a full can give you two meals :) Plenty to share or some to bring home!

I got the Paradise City and split the "Smells Like Teen Spirit" fries which were INCREDIBLE :)

Great good at a great price! The place is small with only about five tables, but has a fun chill vibe.There's a whole wall covered in classic record albums and great music playing. The owner/chef was super friendly even with my very indecisive family. I highly recommend this place anyone looking for casual dining.

This place is amazing. I use yelp reviews a lot, but I hardly ever write one. The level of quality in each of the dishes was great. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable. The atmosphere is fun. There are not enough positive adjectives to describe this place, you need to go here.

An amazing little hole in the wall. Had the Rappers Delight.... and it was. It was simply exquisite! The cheese cake dessert was over the top in a great way! 

You are doing yourself a disservice if you don't stop by here.

This was a new stop for us.  We'll be back.  Great food, in a little tiny place.  We loved the variety - I had a cold couscous salad that was very refreshing while my husband had a chicken dish that melted in your mouth.   If we lived downtown, this would be our go-to take out on the way home.  I may drive out of my way to get it!!!!   Do not miss it.

We were very hungry after attending the March for Science. A quick search on Yelp turned up this place that should be suitable for the whole family. It was an urban space downtown that felt a bit industrial. We ordered off items that each sounded good. Even though there were only a few patrons, it took longer than expected for our food to arrive. Unfortunately, when it did, it tasted mediocre at best, and the food was not heated through all the way. By that time, we were too hungry to care or ask for it to be re-done.

This place is really tucked away but we recently discovered it and have been back probably five times in the last few months. It has a wonderful rock n roll atmosphere and people and truly fantastic food! I'm a sucker for the Buffalo Soldier :)
Highly recommend!!! Food was perfect, atmosphere is fantastic and the staff is beautifully delightful!! I'm coming back to try everything on the menu.

We just finished a late lunch here. Food is outstanding!  Both of us really enjoyed it. The decor is very plain yet the food is as good or better than any high end Strip restaurant.  They also serve wine.  I had Ray of Light. He had Great Balls of Fire. Our friend got a gluten free dish.

3.5 to be fair. 
Food was good, the 1st and 2nd time. The 3rd time, I waited over 30 minutes for the same noodles my friend ordered. Ended up taking my food to go. 
Service has always been so-so. 
The last and final time, I ordered for delivery. Food was disappointing.

If it wasn't for the small space I would have given it 5* but the loud ass squeaky drunk lady sitting right next to me gave me a headache she was so loud -the food made up for itwish it was closer to my house but I will def do a to go order and enjoy it at home:)))) great food and service!
Got a "referral" to check this place out. I love it. Wanted to go back today, but wife says no. I will go back tomorrow.   I can't wait!!!!

Noooooooooodles.

Who knew that you could jazz up the carbohydrate tubes in such a wide variety of ways?! Well, they sure do it right at Rock'N'oodles.

It's easy to miss while driving by, so bookmark this spot. They have a very small parking lot that can fill up fast, so you might have better luck if you find street parking nearby. It's fast-casual counter service, so make your way in, grab a menu and order away. They now offer beer and wine, so grab yourself a cold one while you're at it.

My favorite, so-far, is the Buffalo Soldier. It's like hot wings with a twist. The noodles are tossed in a creamy hot sauce that is too die for with a sprinkling of blue cheese. The chicken is battered and boneless. Perfect. I haven't had a noodle dish that I don't like yet.

What holds me back from that fifth star is the cleanliness of the space. All but a few tables were covered in crumbs and trash. It wasn't busy, so I would have liked to see a bit more effort to keep the open seating area a little on the cleanlier side. Just my preference.

So glad we decided to try something new while in town. The food was amazing. And the service was equally great. Can't wait to come back when I'm town.  All 4 of us really enjoyed our meals. This is definitely a must try for anyone!!!  The ambiance is so amazing. If you love great music and superb food you will love this place!!
Wow. And they deliver.   Awesome food.  Fries are the bomb and the wings are tasty. Way to go.
